f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Add about 1/2 inch grapeseed oil to a skillet or shallow pot. The pan should be large enough to hold all the sticks with plenty of room to turn them over and move them around without feeling crowded.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Add the flours, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and black pepper to a shallow dish large enough to hold all the cheese at once and mix to thoroughly combine.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 In another dish of similar size, add the beaten eggs.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Coat the frozen cheese in the dry mixture, then the egg, then the dry mixture again, then the egg a second time, and finally once again in the dry mixture. Take care to coat the entire surface of the sticks, including the ends.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Prepare a platter and a dish of marinara sauce (or your dip of choice.)
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Heat the oil in the pan to 360F. Youll want to fry the cheese around 350F, so make the oil a little hotter so when the frozen cheese is added, the temperature wont drop too much.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 When the oil is hot, add all the cheese sticks. Flip them over after about 30 seconds, and continue turning them every 20-30 seconds until they're golden in color. No matter how well you coated the sticks, some cheese may begin to leak. Excessively leaky ones are likely done cooking; remove them from the pan first.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 When all the sticks are golden, remove them to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
f243eceb-247a-4a63-8810-655623430ba7 Transfer the mozzarella sticks to the platter, and serve immediately.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Gather the ingredients.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Butter a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking pan.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Cook the ziti or similar pasta in boiling salted water following the package instructions. Drain well.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, seasoned salt, garlic powder, and half of the mozzarella cheese. Taste and adjust seasoning, as needed. Add the egg and blend well.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Stir in the drained pasta and transfer to the prepared baking dish. Pour the spaghetti sauce over all.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Bake in the heated oven for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with the remaining cup of mozzarella cheese and the 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese, and bake for 5 minutes longer, or until the mozzarella cheese has melted.
3e70811b-e672-427b-9649-201c6e2bdd69 Serve the ziti casserole with a fresh tossed salad and baked or grilled garlic bread.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Gather the ingredients.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Cook the ziti in boiling salted water following the package directions. Drain well and set aside.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Lightly butter a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 While the ziti is cooking, drizzle the olive oil in a large skillet or sauté pan and place it over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the ground beef, onion, and green bell pepper. Cook, stirring until the onion is tender and the beef is no longer pink.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Drain off the excess fat and then add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, basil, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Add the cooked pasta and half of the mozzarella cheese.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Top the casserole with the remaining mozzarella cheese.
142de3c1-f487-4a85-8c5f-63db5121f411 Bake the ziti casserole for 25 to 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Gather the ingredients.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Place the eggs in a shallow bowl or pan, and whisk them together with the oregano and some salt and pepper.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Stir the parmesan cheese and garlic into the bread crumbs and place them in another shallow pan.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Dip the steaks first in the egg mixture, then in the bread crumbs, coating them well with the crumbs.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet, and cook steaks for several minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy. Drain steaks on paper towels.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Place steaks on a baking sheet. Turn on oven broiler.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Top each steak with a slice of ham, 2 to 3 tablespoons tomato sauce, and 1/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle Italian seasoning over the cheese and place steaks under the broiler until cheese melts.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Serve warm, with fries.
9db22608-fd78-47e5-96a3-f73aba4364b5 Enjoy!
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 F.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 In a large pot, combine the butter and olive oil heat on medium high until melted. Add the chopped onions and garlic and saute until translucent and fragrant.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Add the flour and whisk until it is all incorporated. Cook on medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. This will cook off the flour taste and help the sauce to thicken later on.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Add the half and half and heavy cream. Whisk until combined. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently until the mixture has thickened.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Stir the Parmesan cheese and frozen spinach into the white sauce. Heat on low heat until the spinach is warmed through and completely defrosted. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add a little milk if the sauce is too thick.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 In a separate medium sized bowl, whisk together the ricotta cheese, egg, and salt and pepper.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Add a layer of the white spinach sauce to the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Layer two matzo crackers on top of the sauce.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Add about a 1/2 cup to 3/4 cup of the ricotta cheese mixture to the top of the crackers. Spread it out evenly. Then repeat with the sauce, matzo, and ricotta cheese.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Once you've reached the top of the casserole dish, top with the whole milk and mozzarella cheese.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Cover the casserole dish with aluminum foil and place it on a sheet tray in case it overflows while baking. Bake for 45 minutes or until bubbly. Remove the foil and allow the top to brown in the oven for an additional 15 minutes.
f72771de-365a-454a-a760-a5d5a5a0b360 Serve immediately and enjoy!
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Gather the ingredients.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 In a small pot over medium heat, warm the milk to 100 to 105 F.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Place warmed milk in a small bowl and stir the sugar into the milk. Sprinkle the yeast over the sugar milk mixture, and set aside for 5 to 10 minutes, until mixture is bubbly.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Place the flour, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and salt in the bowl of a standing mixer and mix together briefly using the dough hook. Add the yeast/milk mixture and begin to knead, adding the water gradually. The mixture should come together as a soft, stretchy dough, pulling away from the sides of the bowl.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Knead for 5 to 10 minutes, until dough is smooth, soft and elastic.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Oil a bowl with olive oil and place the dough in the bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let the dough rise on the counter until doubled in size.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 While the dough is rising, peel and slice the onion into very thin strips. Place them in a bowl of cold salt water and soak for 30 minutes. Drain onions well and dry them with paper towels.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide dough into two pieces. Roll each half into a smooth ball.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Pour 3 tablespoons of olive oil into a 12-inch pizza pan or cast iron skillet. Place one ball of dough in the middle of the pan and flatten gently with your fingers. Let dough relax for 10 minutes.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Continue to flatten dough into the pan, flattening it and pushing it toward the sides of the pan, letting it relax in between until dough covers the bottom of the pan. Oil the counter and roll the other piece of dough into a 12-inch circle, letting it relax in between until it holds its shape.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Preheat oven to 450 F. Place the slices of mozzarella cheese over the dough in the pan. Sprinkle the provolone over the mozzarella. Place the other round of dough over the cheese and seal the edges of the two dough circles together.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Top the pizza with the sliced onions. Drizzle a tablespoon of olive oil over the onions, and sprinkle with the dried oregano and some Parmesan cheese.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Place the fugazzeta in the oven. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and crispy. Brown the onions under the broiler for the last 3 minutes of cooking if desired.
04f85d07-4158-4dc7-ad9e-bcd8a8cf1433 Remove from the oven. Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into slices to serve.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Gather the ingredients.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Heat the oven to 350 F / 180 C / Gas 4. Lightly grease or spray a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef, sausage, and onion. Cook, stirring until the meat is no longer pink and the onion is translucent.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Add the garlic to the meat mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, and crushed red pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 to 12 minutes. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese, the egg, and 1 cup of Mozzarella cheese. Stir until well blended.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f While the sauce is simmering, cook the ziti in boiling salted water following directions on the package. Drain well.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Add the hot drained pasta to the bowl with the ricotta cheese mixture. Toss lightly to blend.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Add 2 cups of the meat sauce to the ziti mixture.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Transfer half of the pasta mixture into the prepared baking dish.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Spread about half of the meat sauce over the pasta, and then top with the remaining Parmesan cheese and half of the remaining Mozzarella.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Top with the remaining pasta mixture.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Then finish with the remaining meat sauce and remaining Mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with the chopped parsley.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Bake for 25 minutes, or until hot and bubbly around the edges.
17c324bb-450e-4752-ab6b-2b839a9ff75f Serve with garlic bread and a tossed green salad or Caesar salad.
bb0e7570-77fb-4694-a9fa-2f1474e82d99 Pour oil to a depth of 2" in a 6 quart Dutch oven. Heat over medium-high heat until your deep-fry thermometer reads 350°.
bb0e7570-77fb-4694-a9fa-2f1474e82d99 Divide mozzarella slices among 4 slices of bread. Season with salt and pepper, and cover with the remaining cheese slices to make 4 sandwiches. Trim the crusts.
bb0e7570-77fb-4694-a9fa-2f1474e82d99 Take out 3 bowls and place the flour in one bowl, the eggs (cracked and whisked) in another and the breadcrumbs in the last bowl. Dredge each sandwich in flour, coat in eggs and coat in breadcrumbs before putting on the frying pan.
bb0e7570-77fb-4694-a9fa-2f1474e82d99 Fry until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes on each side.
bb0e7570-77fb-4694-a9fa-2f1474e82d99 Let each sandwich rest for about a minute after it's been removed from the oil, then spoon some sauce over the top and serve.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Gather the ingredients.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Cut round bread loaf in half horizontally.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Spread half the bottom portion with olive salad mix, then layer on meats and cheeses.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Cover with top of the bread. Ideally, the sandwich should be made an hour or more in advance and then tightly wrapped in plastic wrap to enable the juices to soak into the bread.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Slice into quarters and serve.
cb3ce3db-f1c6-4711-aa3f-2b010440c98c Enjoy!
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f In a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat. Add the carrot, celery, and onion. Cook, stirring, until onion is softened and beginning to brown. Add the ground beef and sausage and cook, stirring and breaking up, until no longer pink. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, and water. Add the bay leaf and simmer over low heat for about 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon of chopped parsley. Remove the bay leaf and set aside.
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f Heat the oven to 375 F
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f Lightly grease a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan. .
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f In a medium bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon of parsley, and the large egg. Stir until smooth and well blended.
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f Cover the bottom of the prepared pan with a thin layer of the sauce. Cover the sauce layer with lasagna noodles. Top with about one-third of the remaining sauce and half of the ricotta mixture. Sprinkle with a generous layer of mozzarella cheese. Repeat with another layer of the noodles and another one-third of the sauce. Top with the remaining ricotta mixture and more mozzarella. Cover with another layer of lasagna noodles, then top with the remaining sauce and a layer of mozzarella cheese.
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f Cover the pan loosely with foil, tenting somewhat so the foil won't stick to the cheese as it melts.
c58b3ffc-6b2f-4d03-aa14-f27f064c6a9f Bake for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer, or until hot and bubbly and the cheese has melted.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d Gather the ingredients.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d First turn your broiler on to high. Next, begin by smearing the tomato paste onto one slice of bread.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d Top with mozzarella and the remaining piece of bread and butter the outside. Sprinkle each side with garlic powder and salt and set aside.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d Heat a small frying pan over medium heat and add the sandwich. Let it cook for a few minutes on each side until the entire exterior is light golden brown and the cheese is mostly melted. At this point remove from the frying pan and carefully place the hot sandwich onto a baking sheet.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d On the lighter colored of the two sides, smear on the tomato paste and add torn basil leaves. Top with asiago and parmesan and pepperoni. Sprinkle with a little bit of red pepper flakes and put it in the oven and let it broil.
4e69ecd3-5525-4391-8ee5-16e640b71a4d Once the cheese starts to bubble and the top resembles pizza, it's time to take it out of the oven. Be sure to let it sit for a few minutes before slicing into it - so that the cheese doesn't ooze out all over the place! Enjoy!
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Place rice, stock, and olive oil in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover, cooking for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and add the butter and parmesan cheese. Stir and add more broth if it is too dry. Cover and let sit off of the heat for 10 minutes. Allow the rice to cool to room temperature before beginning to make the arancini. You can make the risotto ahead of time and store in the refrigerator until you are ready to assemble.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Take a golf ball sized scoop of risotto rice, make a well in the center and place the cheese inside. Wrap the rice around the piece of cheese and place on a parchment lined baking tray. Repeat with remaining rice and cheese.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Freeze the balls on the baking tray for 2-3 hours or overnight.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Place the flour in a low dish, add 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Place eggs in another low dish with the milk. Whisk together and add a 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Place the breadcrumbs in another low dish and add 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Dip the rice ball into the flour mixture and coat. Then dip into the egg mixture and coat. Then dip it into the Panko bread crumbs and roll to coat completely. Repeat with the remaining rice balls.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed, deep pot on high until it is about 375 F. Turn it down to medium heat and add in a few rice balls at a time to cook.
011e8a71-70e1-4900-a88d-47bf5d2ba5ff Rotate them in the oil as they are cooking to ensure browning on all sides. Remove the rice balls from the oil when they are golden brown. Place the rice balls on another parchment lined baking dish and keep in a 250 F oven while cooking the remaining arancini.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Peel the onion and chop it coarsely.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion to the skillet and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Crumble the ground beef into the skillet and cook until it is no longer pink, stirring frequently; drain well.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Add the garlic, tomato sauce, tomato paste, salt and oregano and basil to the skillet. Continue cooking until the mixture begins to simmer.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Spoon a layer of meat sauce onto the bottom of the slow cooker. Add a double layer of broken lasagna noodles and top with a layer of the cheeses. Repeat the layers with more sauce, noodles, and cheeses, ending with cheese.
b644e6d0-1282-4f53-afac-5f8f3545a3c8 Cover the crock pot and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 In a saucier or saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and saute, occasionally stirring with a wooden spoon, until onions are soft and translucent about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, continually stirring, for 30 seconds. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, and Italian herbs and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Continue to simmer over medium-low heat while you prepare the rest of the lasagna ingredients season to taste with salt and pepper.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 Preheat the oven to 350F. In a medium skillet, heat olive oil. Add mushrooms and saute over medium heat, occasionally stirring, until mushrooms are softened and brown, about 7 to 9 minutes. Set aside.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, eggs, parmesan cheese, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a generous pinch of black pepper. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the spinach and broccoli.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 In a glass or ceramic baking dish measuring approximately 9x13 inches, spread a generous ladleful of tomato sauce along with the bottom with a spatula. Place a single layer of lasagna noodles on the sauce (you'll probably need four, and they can overlap slightly to fit the pan). Spread about one-third of the ricotta mixture on the noodles, and then evenly spread the spinach-broccoli mixture over the ricotta. Sprinkle with about one-third of the shredded mozzarella cheese. Add another layer of noodles, then another third of the ricotta mixture, and evenly layer the zucchini slices over the ricotta. Top evenly with a thin layer of sauce and a sprinkling of mozzarella cheese. For the final layer, add one more row of lasagna noodles, the remaining ricotta cheese, the mushrooms, the remaining tomato sauce, and the remaining mozzarella cheese. Bake in a 350F oven for 45 to 50 minutes, until cheese is melting and bubbling. Remove from oven and let stand for 15 minutes before cutting and serving.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 For the final layer, add one more row of lasagna noodles, the remaining ricotta cheese, the mushrooms, the remaining tomato sauce, and the remaining mozzarella cheese.
f6497406-e867-4ec5-98ff-bfc73c02ba82 Bake in a 350F oven for 45 to 50 minutes, until cheese is melting and bubbling. Remove from oven and let stand for 15 minutes before cutting and serving.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Heat oven to 375 F. Lightly oil a baking pan or spray with nonstick cooking spray.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Put the chicken, one piece at a time, in a food storage bag and pound gently with a meat mallet or other heavy object until about 1/4 inch thick. Repeat with all of the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Saute the garlic in butter for about 1 minute, just to soften. Combine the garlic with basil leaves. Spread basil mixture over each chicken breast; top with a slice of Mozzarella cheese or a little of the shredded Mozzarella cheese. Roll the chicken up and secure with toothpicks.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Beat the egg in a shallow bowl.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e In a wide bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and parsley.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Carefully dip the rolled chicken breasts in the egg; turning to coat well, then coat with breadcrumbs. Arrange the chicken breast rolls on the baking sheet. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Heat 3 tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender and browned. Add garlic, green onions, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and a dash of pepper. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute longer; add the flour and stir until well blended. Add the chicken broth and simmer for about 2 minutes. Add cream and heat through.
2b7f561e-1be0-48b7-bf66-1b18deaa565e Serve the chicken with the sauce, along with noodles or rice and a side vegetable.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Gather the ingredients
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Heat oven to 350 F.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Grease a 2- to 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Cook the penne pasta in boiling salted water following package directions. Drain in a colander and set aside.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken, mushrooms, and Creole seasoning.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Cook until the chicken is thoroughly cooked and the mushrooms are lightly browned, stirring frequently.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Remove the chicken and mushroom mixture to a bowl and set aside.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Melt the butter in the same skillet and add the minced garlic. Cook, stirring, for about 1 minute.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Blend the flour into the butter mixture until smooth and bubbly.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Continue to cook the flour and butter roux for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Add the milk and chicken broth and continue to cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 To the sauce, add 1 1/2 cups of the mozzarella cheese and about half of the Parmesan cheese; cook until the cheese has melted, stirring constantly.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Stir in the chicken and mushroom mixture and the artichokes. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Combine the sauce and pasta; transfer to the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining cheeses and sprinkle lightly with paprika, if using.
b5fb9c3d-18c2-4053-a97b-22871899e3b1 Bake for about 20 to 30 minutes, until lightly browned and bubbly.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Gather the ingredients.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Preheat oven to 425 F. Line a baking sheet with nonstick foil or parchment paper.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Brush cut sides of French bread with melted butter. Sprinkle lightly with onion powder and garlic powder. Top with blue cheese or Gorgonzola cheese, tomatoes, chives or green onions, mozzarella, and parsley.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Bake about 10 to 15 minutes, until bread is crusty on the outside and the top is melted and just beginning to turn golden.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Serve as is for an appetizer or serve it as an accompaniment for a classic spaghetti dinner or any other pasta dish like linguine with clam sauce.
e166956d-987f-4a1e-9c78-72a2627ea397 Enjoy!
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Preheat the oven to 325 F.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 In a medium mixing bowl, beat the eggs then add the cottage cheese and Parmesan cheese. Spray a 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish with non-stick cooking spray or a homemade olive oil spray.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Put one layer of the slightly cooked lasagna noodles flat across the bottom of the baking dish. Add about half of the spinach, pressing down lightly and evenly over the noodles. Top with another layer of lasagna noodles. Top this layer of noodles with the cottage cheese mixture. Add the remaining spinach then the last of the lasagna noodles, laying evenly on top of spinach.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Once you've layered everything, spread the pasta sauce evenly over the top and sprinkle the whole thing with mozzarella cheese. Press down lightly.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Cover baking dish with foil, using foil sprayed with cooking spray and keeping foil off the center of the lasagna. Secure sides tightly over the baking dish.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Bake about 1 hour 15 minutes in the preheated oven. To lightly brown the top, remove foil for a few minutes at the end of baking time.
76f80254-48a2-4be7-a4e2-b59f34088c73 Allow to rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 In a saucepan, combine tomatoes, garlic, bay leaf, thyme, cayenne pepper, olive oil, sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 Cook lasagna noodles in boiling salted water for about 10 minutes, or until just tender. Drain and run cold water over the noodles to stop the cooking; pat dry.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 Preheat the oven to 375 F.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 In a cup, stir a few tablespoons of cold water into the 3 tablespoons flour. Stir until a smooth paste forms. Place chicken broth and milk in a saucepan and heat. Add flour mixture to the liquid; add salt and pepper to taste, then stir in parsley. Continue to cook, stirring until mixture is thickened and bubbling.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 Pour a thin layer of the tomato sauce mixture into a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan. Top with a layer of lasagna noodles placed side-by-side. Add a layer of chicken; sprinkle some of the mozzarella cheese over chicken. Top with a layer of the white sauce. Add another layer of lasagna, more tomato sauce, another layer of chicken, mozzarella cheese, and white sauce; repeat until all ingredients are used or the baking dish is full, finishing with a layer of lasagna noodles. Sprinkle with the grated Parmesan cheese.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 Bake at 375 F for 25 to 35 minutes, or until browned and bubbly.
3d6ae566-c54b-4863-a1e8-ac4bf8fe0ce3 Makes about 6 servings.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Gather the ingredients.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Using a serrated knife, slice an Italian sub roll in half lengthwise.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Drizzle the inside with Italian extra virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Add basil and tomato to one side and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Top with fresh mozzarella and close sandwich.
5d643cbc-a752-4e14-bf42-e9c63079b863 Eat now or wrap tightly to enjoy later.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Gather the ingredients.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain well. Set aside.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba In a large bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, Italian seasonings, a bit of salt and pepper, and half of the marinara pasta sauce. Add cooked pasta, tossing gently to combine well.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Preheat oven to 350 F.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Use half of the remaining marinara sauce to cover the bottom of a casserole dish, then spoon pasta and cheese mixture on top in an even layer. Cover with remaining marinara sauce, then sprinkle the top with mozzarella cheese.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Remove cover and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until golden brown and hot throughout.
c11ea9ec-53ad-4372-a31a-005f7a2505ba Serve and enjoy!
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Gather the ingredients.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Preheat the oven to 375 F. Spray a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish with nonstick baking spray containing flour and set aside.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the penne to the water and cook according to the package directions.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 When the pasta is done, drain well and set aside.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Add the Alfredo sauce and milk to the onion mixture and heat until steaming.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Add the Havarti, provolone, mozzarella, and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese to this mixture and cook over low heat until cheese melts.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Stir in drained pasta and the meatballs.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Pour the mixture into the prepared dish. Top with the remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the casserole is bubbly around the edges and the cheese starts to brown on top.
012ce4e7-b792-4b4c-b34d-cc7c13214c35 Serve and enjoy!
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Gather the ingredients.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Combine the salt, seasoned salt, chili powder, and pepper in a small bowl. Trim the pork chops and discard any excess fat.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; sear the pork chops for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, seasoning both sides with 1 teaspoon of the seasoning mixture as they cook.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Drain off any excess fat, leaving the pork chops in the skillet. Add the rice to the skillet along with the tomatoes, green bell pepper, onion, olives, and sugar. Arrange sliced zucchini around the edge of the skillet and sprinkle with remaining seasoning mixture.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through (at least 145 F/63 C) and the rice is tender. If you are using brown rice, allow extra time.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Top with the mozzarella cheese and cover the pan. Cook for about 2 minutes longer, or until the cheese has melted.
59454a31-7e84-44ab-ba59-445c8021d379 Serve and enjoy!
bd47dda8-e256-410d-8692-f2fdf5834156 Use a serrated knife to cut the Italian sub roll in half. Place sub roll on butcher or wax paper and drizzle both sides with a really nice olive oil.
bd47dda8-e256-410d-8692-f2fdf5834156 Add mozzarella to one-half and sprinkle with salt. Next, add roasted red peppers, genoa salami, and a handful of fresh washed basil.
bd47dda8-e256-410d-8692-f2fdf5834156 Close the sandwich and tightly wrap the butcher or wax paper around it. Roll and cut down the middle. Serve immediately or wrap it up for later. The sandwich is good for 24 hours if refrigerated properly.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Gather the ingredients.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Preheat the oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas 6.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Line a baking sheet with foil; spray with olive oil spray or nonstick cooking spray.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa In a food processor, grind the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, basil, parsley, a dash of pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt until fine. Pour this mixture onto a plate or shallow bowl.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Pound the chicken breasts halves lightly to flatten them to a uniform thickness. (You can avoid some kitchen mess and contaminating your surfaces if you place the breasts between sheets of plastic wrap before gently pounding them with a mallet or rolling pin.) If you are using thin cutlets, there should be no need to pound them.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Whisk the egg with the milk in a shallow bowl.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture then coat them with the breadcrumb mixture. Arrange the chicken pieces on the baking sheet.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Bake the chicken for 15 minutes, then turn the chicken over and bake for 10 minutes longer. To ensure the chicken is done, check with an instant-read thermometer. According to the USDA, the minimum safe temperature for chicken is 165 F. Remove the chicken from the oven and reduce the oven temperature to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa In an 11-by-7-inch baking dish, spread about one-third of the spaghetti sauce. Arrange the cooked chicken in the sauce; pour remaining sauce over chicken. Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Place the pan into the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes longer, or until the sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water following the package directions. Drain the pasta thoroughly.
766110f2-74da-4ff3-8750-bc7452e059aa Serve the chicken and sauce with the hot drained spaghetti. Enjoy!
4878c662-3646-44aa-884e-c6f3978fe886 Fold a 30-inch long piece of foil in half lengthwise. Place in bottom of a slow cooker with both ends hanging over top edge of cooker. I also put a piece of crumpled foil in the bottom to keep the meatloaf out of the fat. The foil strip will make it much easier to remove the meatloaf when it's done.
4878c662-3646-44aa-884e-c6f3978fe886 In a large bowl, mix ground beef with bread crumbs, 1/2 cup spaghetti sauce, egg, onion, salt, garlic powder, Italian herbs, and pepper until well blended. Shape into a loaf. Place in slow cooker. Spread 3 tablespoons spaghetti sauce over the loaf.
4878c662-3646-44aa-884e-c6f3978fe886 Cover and cook on HIGH for 2 1/2 to 3 hours or on LOW for 5 to 6 hours, or until juices run clear. Top loaf with cheese slices, overlapping, and continue to cook (turn to HIGH if necessary) for 15 to 25 minutes longer.
4878c662-3646-44aa-884e-c6f3978fe886 Use ends of foil to lift out meat loaf and transfer to a serving platter.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Gather the ingredients.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Cut the large tomatoes into approximately 1/4-inch slices. Use a serrated knife for the cleanest cuts.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Cut the fresh mozzarella cheese into 1/4 inch slices.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Salt the sliced tomatoes generously with kosher salt and set aside.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Whisk together the balsamic vinegar and sugar in a small saucepan. Cook on medium low heat and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until thickened. Stir occasionally as it cooks and don't leave it unattended because it can easily scorch.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Layer a salted tomato, then one to two basil leaves, followed by a slice of mozzarella.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Keep layering these ingredients until you have filled up your platter. Drizzle with the olive oil, and more salt and pepper.
c6653134-98fc-4d67-b0a3-c988aea5bab0 Drizzle the balsamic vinegar glaze over the top of the salad and serve immediately.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the veal. Cook the veal for about 4 to 6 minutes, turning to brown both sides. Remove the veal and set aside.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Add the onion and green bell pepper to the skillet and cook until tender. Stir in the wine, tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, parsley, and oregano; blend well. Add the veal back to the pan and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir to blend.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti in boiling salted water following the package directions; drain thoroughly.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Mix about half of the sauce into the hot drained spaghetti. Put the spaghetti into a baking pan (approximately 13 x 9 x 2 inches). Top the spaghetti with veal cutlets and the remaining sauce. Top with the cheese slices or an equal amount of shredded mozzarella cheese.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 to 15 minutes, until cheese is melted.
3a205038-a639-457f-a710-4687f6dd1db4 Serve the dish with a tossed green salad and garlic bread, and pass the Parmesan.
4852ea68-14f6-44c3-8882-0df97ca940e8 Preheat the oven to 400 F. Warm the oil over medium-high heat in a chef's pan or large, deep skillet. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the spinach and saute until it is thawed and heated through, about 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from the heat.
4852ea68-14f6-44c3-8882-0df97ca940e8 In a large bowl, combine the spinach, ricotta, and a generous pinch of nutmeg. Season with a few grinds of black pepper and a little salt if desired. If your marinara sauce is salty, you may wish to skip the salt in the cheese mixture. Stir in 1/4 cup of the shredded mozzarella.
4852ea68-14f6-44c3-8882-0df97ca940e8 Place about 1/2 cup of marinara sauce in the bottom of an 8x10x2-inch (or similarly sized) baking dish. Spread the sauce over the bottom of the dish and top with 3 noodles, overlapping slightly. Top the noodles with half of the spinach-ricotta mixture, spreading to cover them evenly. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup of mozzarella. Spoon 1/2 to 3/4 cup sauce over the cheeses, spreading gently with the back of the spoon.
4852ea68-14f6-44c3-8882-0df97ca940e8 Repeat the layering with 3 more noodles, the rest of the ricotta mixture, 1/2 cup of mozzarella, and 1/2 to 3/4 cup of sauce. Top with 3 more noodles. Spoon over enough of the remaining sauce to completely cover the noodles, spreading to the edges to make sure they are coated. Sprinkle evenly with the rest of the mozzarella.
4852ea68-14f6-44c3-8882-0df97ca940e8 Cover the dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the noodles are easily pierced with a knife. Remove the foil and bake for 10 minutes more. Remove the lasagna from the oven and allow to rest for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and cook, stirring, until no longer pink. Add the pepperoni and cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes longer. With a slotted spoon remove the beef and pepperoni to the slow cooker.
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 Add the onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook, stirring, until the onion is translucent. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes longer. Transfer to the slow cooker. Add the pizza sauce, tomatoes, oregano, basil, crushed pepper, and sugar to the slow cooker. Stir to blend ingredients.
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours or cook the sauce on high for 3 to 4 hours.
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 About 15 minutes before the sauce is done, cook the pasta in boiling salted water until "al dente" as directed on the package. Drain well.
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 Stir the drained pasta into the sauce mixture. Stir in half of the Parmesan cheese and half of the mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle the sliced olives over the top and then top with the remaining Parmesan and mozzarella cheese. Cover and continue cooking on low for 15 minutes.
9e709d86-c411-42df-9f1b-0e627689b4c0 Alternatively, combine the drained hot pasta with the sauce and half of the Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses and transfer to a 3-quart baking dish. Top with the sliced olives and remaining Parmesan and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 F for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the sauce is hot and bubbling.
56fcd065-5631-44f1-a015-917026f1adf9 Butter an 11-by-7-inch baking dish. Heat oven to 375 F.
56fcd065-5631-44f1-a015-917026f1adf9 Cook the green beans in a small amount of water until just tender. Drain and arrange in the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the diced tomatoes and shredded cheese. Set aside.
56fcd065-5631-44f1-a015-917026f1adf9 In a saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in flour until well blended. Add the salt, pepper, cream, and sour cream. Heat through, stirring constantly. Spread the cream mixture over the green beans then sprinkle the bread crumbs or French fried onions over all.
56fcd065-5631-44f1-a015-917026f1adf9 Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until browned and bubbly.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Make sure you've pre-cooked the octopus and cut it into bite-sized pieces.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 In a large bowl, make the takoyaki batter by combining flour, dashi broth, and eggs. Mix until well incorporated. Note, the thickness of the batter should be similar to a cream soup and is on the thinner side.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Preheat a takoyaki pan and coat each of the round molds in the pan with canola oil.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Pour batter into the molds so that it is about 3/4 full.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Put octopus, red ginger, green onion, and dried red shrimp in each mold.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Grill takoyaki balls, allowing it to cook about 3 to 4 minutes before flipping the ball over using a takoyaki pick.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Grill the other side of the takoyaki another 3 minutes until golden brown.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 When browned, remove takoyaki from the pan and place on a plate.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Garnish the takoyaki with okonomiyaki sauce (or substitute sauce). Then add mayonnaise, and sprinkle with dried bonito flakes and green aonori seaweed.
ac0f9af4-36d5-4f68-9044-c6072d4897b9 Serve immediately.
7b4a1b9c-3a18-4d28-a0a1-0d77eae8a070 Place three of the tortillas on a work surface. Top the tortillas with half of the cheeses, then the chicken, then the remaining cheeses. Top the filling with the remaining tortillas. Spread outsides of the quesadillas with the butter.
7b4a1b9c-3a18-4d28-a0a1-0d77eae8a070 Heat a flat pan, large skillet, or griddle over medium heat. Add the quesadillas, one at a time, and cook, pressing down with a spatula, until bottoms are browned, about 2 to 4 minutes. Turn quesadillas and cook second side 2 to 3 minutes or until the tortillas are browned and crisp and the cheeses melt.
7b4a1b9c-3a18-4d28-a0a1-0d77eae8a070 Remove the quesadilla with a spatula to the work surface and cut into quarters. Repeat with remaining quesadillas. Serve immediately with salsa for dipping.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 In a large nonstick skillet sprayed with vegetable spray, quickly brown eggplant slices and set aside.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 In the same skillet in hot olive oil, cook onion for about 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until tender.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 Add mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 Cook lasagna noodles in boiling salted water according to package directions.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 Spoon about one-quarter of the sauce Into an 11x7-inch baking dish. Arrange three alternate layers of lasagna noodles, ricotta, mushroom mixture, mozzarella cheese, eggplant slices, sauce, and Parmesan cheese.
841fef21-20cc-47ef-aae2-1970d12d35e5 Bake eggplant lasagna at 350 F for 30 to 40 minutes.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Gather the ingredients.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Preheat oven to 400 F.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Butter a 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish and set aside.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Meanwhile, melt 1/4 cup of the truffle butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Add the flour, salt, and pepper; cook and stir for 1 minute.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Stir in the milk and the cream and bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring with a wire whisk.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook until al dente. Drain well.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Add the cooked pasta to the sauce in the saucepan along with the three kinds of cheeses.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Mix gently, then pour into the prepared baking dish.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Combine the bread crumbs and 2 tablespoons of the melted truffle butter in a small bowl.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Sprinkle over the macaroni and cheese mixture in the dish.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the macaroni mixture is bubbly and the breadcrumbs begin to brown.
854def71-ca21-4739-8b7a-1fab14954724 Serve immediately.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Gather the ingredients.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Cut round steak into 4 to 6 serving-size pieces. Combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper onto a plate. Dredge meat in the seasoned flour and then pound both sides with a meat mallet to tenderize and flatten.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 In a bowl, beat the egg with the water.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Combine breadcrumbs and basil in another bowl.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Dip each piece of flour-coated beef in the egg mixture and then coat thoroughly with the breadcrumb mixture.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. When the skillet is hot, add the vegetable oil or shortening. Brown the coated beef in the hot oil, about 3 to 5 minutes on each side.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Transfer the browned steak to a 2 1/2- to 3-quart baking dish.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, tomato sauce, Parmesan cheese, wine (if using), sugar, oregano, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pour the sauce over the steaks.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Cover the baking dish tightly with foil and bake for about 1 hour and 10 minutes or until the meat is tender.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the meat and continue baking, uncovered, for about 5 minutes or until the cheese has melted.
8fcf10e1-cac6-40a4-a256-15297ffb88e6 Serve and enjoy!
058659ab-f5d1-4c25-8165-dddd459e42a3 Gather the ingredients.
058659ab-f5d1-4c25-8165-dddd459e42a3 Spray the slow cooker crockery insert with nonstick cooking spray.
058659ab-f5d1-4c25-8165-dddd459e42a3 Spread the cream cheese in bottom of the slow cooker. Then mix up the pizza sauce, onion, olives and pepperoni and spread on top of the cream cheese.
058659ab-f5d1-4c25-8165-dddd459e42a3 Sprinkle with the pizza cheese and cook on low until the cheese on top melts.
058659ab-f5d1-4c25-8165-dddd459e42a3 Serve with tortilla chips and enjoy!
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Gather the ingredients.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Preheat the oven to 425°F.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 To prepare the dippers, combine the Parmesan, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder in a bowl. Set aside.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Roll out one pizza dough on a lightly floured work surface and cut into 18 squares. Then cut each square in half diagonally to form two triangles. Arrange the triangles on a baking sheet and brush each one with olive oil. Sprinkle the Parmesan mixture over the triangles. Repeat with the remaining pizza dough. There will be a total of 72 triangles. Bake for 1012 minutes, until golden brown. Remove to a wire rack to cool.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 To prepare the dip, whisk together the cream cheese, sour cream, oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, garlic, pizza sauce, pepperoni, bell pepper, scallions, cheddar, and 3/4 cup mozzarella in a bowl.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Evenly spread out the mixture in a shallow 2-quart ovenproof dish.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Bake for 15 minutes, until bubbly.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Bake for 5 minutes more.
247696a9-b551-4f6c-bd70-592e8d2d2fa5 Serve hot with the dippers.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Gather the ingredients.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Place parsley, basil, oregano, olive oil, lemon juice, and salt in a zip-top bag large enough to hold the mozzarella. Massage to combine.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Add the drained baby mozzarella cheese balls, seal, and toss bag to coat the cheese.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Open the bag, squeeze out all the air, and re-seal.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Let mozzarella balls sit in the marinade at room temperature for 4 hours before serving.
69a162ed-8cd9-4dbc-9270-b21ebd519bc3 Serve and enjoy.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Grease a 12-by-8-by-2-inch baking dish.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Put the beaten eggs in a wide, shallow bowl.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Put the seasoned bread crumb mixture in another wide, shallow bowl.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Wash eggplant and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Dip the eggplant slices in beaten eggs then dredge with seasoned bread crumbs.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Place the breaded slices on a plate and chill for 30 to 45 minutes.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Heat about 1/8-inch of olive oil in a heavy skillet.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Fry the breaded eggplant on both sides until golden brown and crispy. Drain well on paper towels.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 In a saucepan, heat tomato sauce, basil, and oregano.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Spread about one-third of the sauce in the prepared baking dish. Layer half of the eggplant, half of the mozzarella cheese slices, another one-third of the sauce, and half the Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers, ending with the remaining sauce and Parmesan cheese.
1932449b-6ece-4fb3-8178-93f0d1f0fd77 Bake for 30 minutes, or until the dish is hot and bubbly.
2b02bced-63b3-4526-9ca6-572539296506 Prepare and heat an outdoor gas or charcoal grill for medium heat.
2b02bced-63b3-4526-9ca6-572539296506 Combine the ground beef, Italian seasonings and salt in a large bowl and mix gently. Form into 12 thin patties and place on waxed paper.
2b02bced-63b3-4526-9ca6-572539296506 Combine the pepperoni, 1/3 cup pizza sauce, mustard, and Parmesan cheese in a small bowl. Divide this mixture among 6 patties within 1/2" of pattie edges. Top the filling with the remaining patties and press edges together to seal.
2b02bced-63b3-4526-9ca6-572539296506 Grill the patties 4-6" from medium coals for 10 to 15 minutes until meat is thoroughly cooked to 165 F, turning carefully just once. Top each burger with a slice of the mozzarella cheese and the remaining pizza sauce.
2b02bced-63b3-4526-9ca6-572539296506 Grill the buns and, cut side down, and let the cheese melt on the burgers for 1 to 2 minutes, then serve burgers in buns.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Preheat oven to 350 F. Then, spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with nonstick spray.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Cook pasta according to package directions for "al dente." Drain. Pour into prepared baking dish.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Heat oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. While oil is heating, cut chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Brown chicken in oil. Add Italian seasoning, half of the spaghetti sauce and the drained tomatoes. Let simmer 2 to 3 minutes.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Cut cream cheese into small chunks. Add to chicken and tomato sauce mixture. Simmer until cream cheese is melted.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Stir in spinach. Cook another minute, until spinach wilts slightly.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Pour chicken mixture over pasta. Top with one cup of the shredded mozzarella. Top with the remaining spaghetti sauce, remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
a5000279-ede4-4808-b9e9-38d1625a010a Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes, or until bubbly.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe Cut the eggplant in 1/2-inch slices; place in bowl in layers, sprinkling each layer with salt. Let stand 30 minutes to drain excess moisture; dry on paper towels.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe In a shallow bowl beat the eggs with 1/3 cup water and the flour. Dip the eggplant slices in batter, letting excess drip off.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté the eggplant slices in batches just until lightly browned, turning to brown both sides.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe Combine seasoned bread crumbs with the Parmesan cheese in a small bowl.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe In the crock pot, layer one-quarter of the eggplant, top with one-quarter of the crumbs, one-quarter of the marinara sauce and one-quarter of the Mozzarella cheese. Repeat to make four layers of eggplant, crumbs, sauce and mozzarella cheese.
96e1038c-2771-48e7-974a-d16cea53d6fe Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Gather the ingredients.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Preheat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Butter a 2 1/2 to 3-quart shallow baking dish or casserole.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Cook the penne pasta in boiling salted water as directed on package; drain well and set aside.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion to the pan and cook for about 4 minutes, or until it is translucent. Add the garlic to the onion and continue cooking for 1 minute.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Add the tomatoes, basil, and oregano to the onion and garlic. Cook until heated through, stirring frequently.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Taste and add salt and pepper.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 In a large bowl, combine the cooked, drained penne, the tomato sauce mixture, and 1 cup of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Stir to blend the ingredients thoroughly.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Spoon the pasta and sauce mixture into the prepared casserole.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Sprinkle the remaining 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese over the top.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Bake the casserole for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until the pasta is hot and bubbly and the cheese has melted.
5dd68eed-d980-4c3c-bc39-4e42671b7848 Serve and enjoy!
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Gather the ingredients.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Preheat the oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas 6.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Line two baking sheets with foil. Brush foil with a little of the olive oil.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Arrange slices of eggplant over the bottom of one of the baking sheets; brush slices with olive oil and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Arrange bell pepper and mushrooms on the other baking sheet.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Bake in the preheated oven for about 8 minutes. Turn the vegetables and bake for 7 to 8 minutes longer. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Grease a 3-quart baking dish. Arrange a layer of eggplant slices in the bottom of the baking dish. Top with a few slices of bell pepper, some mushrooms, and about 1/3 of the sauce. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers two more times, then sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Bake the casserole for 25 to 30 minutes, until vegetables are tender and cheese is melted.
9cce9900-1b84-4cc8-b58d-2d8c8c703b66 Serve and enjoy!
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Pound chicken breast halves until evenly thin. Dredge chicken with flour.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Cook chicken in butter for about 4 to 6 minutes on each side, until tender and cooked through.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Remove chicken to a shallow baking dish; sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Add 1 tablespoon butter to the skillet and sauté mushrooms until tender.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Arrange mushroom slices on top of each piece of chicken; cover with a slice of cheese. Place the remaining mushrooms around the chicken.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Place chicken breasts under a hot broiler until cheese is melted.
a1398890-9233-4b0d-b1e8-941fcfc95e08 Serve immediately with hot buttered pasta or rice.
80e8b3d9-80bc-45f2-802b-ae48571851f2 Preheat oven to 350 F. In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir 2 minutes. Add red bell pepper; cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes longer until vegetables are crisp-tender. Remove from heat. Chop artichoke hearts into small pieces.
80e8b3d9-80bc-45f2-802b-ae48571851f2 In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until softened. Gradually beat in mayonnaise until smooth. Add sautéed vegetables and artichoke hearts.
80e8b3d9-80bc-45f2-802b-ae48571851f2 Stir in half of the Parmesan cheese and all of the Monterey Jack and mozzarella cheese. Place in 8" square baking dish that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese.
80e8b3d9-80bc-45f2-802b-ae48571851f2 Bake for 25 to 35 minutes until dip begins to bubble around the edges. Serve warm with lightly toasted baguette slices.
80e8b3d9-80bc-45f2-802b-ae48571851f2 You can make this dip ahead of time; just cover and refrigerate up to 24 hours. When it's time to eat, bake for 5 to 10 minutes longer until the dip is hot and bubbling around the edges. Don't overbake or the dip will separate.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Heat oven to 350 F.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Cook pasta in boiling water following package directions. Drain and rinse with hot water.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Brown the ground beef for about 5 minutes. Add onion, green pepper, and mushrooms and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until beef is no longer pink and vegetables are tender.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Stir in the spaghetti sauce, cream of mushroom soup, and diced tomatoes. Cook, stirring, until hot. Add salt and pepper, to taste.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Spread half of the pasta in the prepared baking dish. Spoon half of the sauce over the pasta, then top with half of the cheese. Repeat layers with the remaining pasta, sauce, and cheese.
6590bc79-8acf-4e75-9145-0c55e7b53215 Bake for 20 to 30 minutes, until hot and bubbly.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Heat oven to 350 F.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Lightly grease a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add ground beef, carrot, onion, and celery. Cook, breaking the ground beef up and stirring until ground beef is browned and onion is tender.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Add the bell pepper, zucchini, garlic, Creole seasoning, and oregano or Italian seasoning. Continue cooking, stirring, for about 2 minutes.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, and wine or more water; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Combine the sauce mixture with the cooked, drained rigatoni.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Spoon half of the pasta mixture into the baking dish; sprinkle evenly with half of the cheese. Top with remaining pasta mixture and remaining cheese.
3ca532c3-da5b-452c-a32f-416a11f11f2e Bake for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
3d771748-9124-4893-a275-746a85680b80 Wash and trim the end of stems from mushrooms. Pop the remaining stem out. Chop stems and set aside. Melt 2 tablespoons butter; brush over mushrooms. Spray a shallow baking dish (about 8-inch square, or one which will fit mushrooms in one layer) with butter-flavored spray or grease with butter.
3d771748-9124-4893-a275-746a85680b80 Heat remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a skillet. Chop green onions; combine with reserved chopped mushroom stems, ham, and garlic. Add to skillet along with the spinach; sauté until tender. Add bread crumbs, salt, and pepper to vegetable mixture; stir well. Add a little cream to moisten more if necessary.
3d771748-9124-4893-a275-746a85680b80 Fill each mushroom cap with a little of the stuffing, mounding the filling. Top each filled mushroom cap with some of the shredded Mozzarella cheese.
3d771748-9124-4893-a275-746a85680b80 Bake at 350 F for about 20 minutes, until the cheese is melted and mushroom caps are tender.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Gather the ingredients.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Place spinach in 4-quart Dutch oven. Cover and cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes or until wilted.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Drain the spinach in a colander, pressing with a spoon to squeeze out as much liquid as possible. Set aside.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Puree the tomatoes in a food processor or blender until smooth.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Cook ground chuck, mushrooms, onion, and garlic in the same Dutch oven over medium heat for 10 minutes or until ground beef is browned. Pour off excess fat.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Add the pureed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, 2 tablespoons of the parsley, oregano, basil, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and hot sauce or crushed pepper flakes, if using. Blend well. Cook over high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to low; simmer, partially covered, for 45 minutes.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine the drained spinach, remaining 2 tablespoons parsley, ricotta cheese, half of the mozzarella cheese, the beaten eggs, 4 tablespoons of the Parmesan cheese, salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and nutmeg; mix well.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Preheat oven to 350 F. Pour 1 1/2 cups of the prepared sauce in a 9-by-13-inch baking pan (3-quart) or baking dish.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Spread 1/3 cup of the spinach-cheese filling on a cooked lasagna noodle.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Roll up and place on the sauce in the baking dish. Repeat with the remaining noodles.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Top the rolls with the remaining sauce and remaining 2 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Bake the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Top with the remaining mozzarella cheese and Parmesan cheese. Return to the oven for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
d26d63db-7440-430b-a0cf-5faab6e8b77e Let stand 10 minutes before serving.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following the package directions, just until tender and still firm; drain and set aside.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet. When the skillet is hot, add the ground beef making sure to break it up into smaller chunks with a spatula or wooden spoon as it cooks. Add the onion to the skillet and continue to cook until the beef is no longer pink. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute longer; drain mixture well.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Remove the skillet from the heat and add the mozzarella cheese, bread crumbs, parsley, and egg. Mix together thoroughly.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Stuff the meat and cheese mixture into the drained pasta shells set aside.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Pour about half of the spaghetti sauce or marinara into the slow cooker insert.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Arrange stuffed shells in the sauce.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Spoon the remaining sauce over the stuffed shells and then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
1e063ce3-2b3a-4f21-b88c-d0c4a72f7056 Cover the pot and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Gather the ingredients.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Preheat oven to 200 F.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Place sun-dried tomatoes in a small bowl. Cover them completely with boiling water. Set aside for 10 minutes, or until you assemble the rest of your ingredients.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc When tomatoes have reconstituted, drain the liquid.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Arrange the mozzarella cheese, basil, and Parmesan cheese in bowls or on plates near the stove for easy access.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc In a small bowl, beat 3 eggs together with 2 tablespoons milk.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Heat a medium (10-inch) nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and tilt pan to coat it completely with melted butter.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc When butter foams, add the egg mixture and use a rubber spatula to rapidly stir eggs in pan for a few seconds.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Then shake pan to evenly distribute eggs, and let cook over medium-high heat until eggs are nearly set.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Sprinkle about 1/4 cup mozzarella, 1 tablespoon basil, 1/4 cup tomatoes, and 1 teaspoon Parmesan cheese over one-half of the omelet. Season omelet lightly with salt and pepper.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Run the rubber spatula lightly under the other half to make sure it's not stuck, then gently fold the egg mixture over the filling.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Let cook another minute or two to let cheese melt, then slide the omelet out of the skillet onto a plate.
4619b75d-b28d-4439-9b9e-693b2458b8fc Keep warm in a 200 F oven while you repeat the process to create additional omelets with the remaining ingredients. Serve omelets warm.
a5404bc0-da43-4f05-94cb-5389aa8ccc37 Gather the ingredients.
a5404bc0-da43-4f05-94cb-5389aa8ccc37 Heat the oven to 400 F.
a5404bc0-da43-4f05-94cb-5389aa8ccc37 Add yeast to the water and stir until dissolved. Add sugar, oil, flour, and salt. Set mixing bowl filled with dough in warm water for 5 minutes to rise. Pat dough out on a well-greased pizza pan or cookie sheet.
a5404bc0-da43-4f05-94cb-5389aa8ccc37 Layer toppings on dough in the order listed.
a5404bc0-da43-4f05-94cb-5389aa8ccc37 Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the crust is browned.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Heat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish, or spray with cooking spray.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Cook pasta in boiling salted water following package directions; drain, and rinse with hot water.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, heat butter over medium-low heat. Stir in flour until smooth and bubbly. Add the milk, and continue cooking, stirring, until thickened.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Add the basil and the salt and pepper to taste.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Stir in the spinach leaves until wilted; stir in the hot drained pasta.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Stir in the mozzarella cheese until well blended. Spoon the pasta mixture into the prepared baking dish.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 In a bowl, toss bread crumbs with the melted butter; sprinkle over the pasta mixture.
229688aa-f11a-467d-9a97-62b2b31add81 Bake for 20 to 30 minutes, or until nicely browned and hot.
f4f17cbd-a117-4dfe-a6b3-7f63f0d45b8f Gather the ingredients.
f4f17cbd-a117-4dfe-a6b3-7f63f0d45b8f In a saucepan combine the blackberries, blueberries, cornstarch, vanilla, sugar, and water. Cover and cook over a medium-low heat. Once simmering, mash and mix well. Set aside.
f4f17cbd-a117-4dfe-a6b3-7f63f0d45b8f Toast the bread.
f4f17cbd-a117-4dfe-a6b3-7f63f0d45b8f Slather each slice with goat cheese and top with a spoonful of the warm berry mixture. Sprinkle with some chopped fresh mint if you have it.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Gather the ingredients.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Preheat an oven to 425 F.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Roll out the puff pastry into a 10-inch tart pan and bake it for 18 to 22 minutes until it puffs and turns golden brown. Or, for individual tarts roll out the pastry and cut into squares and with a small, sharp knife score a border inside each one taking care not to cut right through. Bake as above.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Once baked and golden brown, remove the pastry from the oven and leave to cool completely.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Spread the Dijon mustard in an even layer over the browned pastry, leaving 1/2-inch of the edges empty.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Dry the tomato slices with kitchen paper. Arrange the tomato and goats cheese slices neatly over the mustard.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Sprinkle the tomato slices with the remaining sea salt, pepper, goat cheese, and fresh herbs. Serve the tart at room temperature or chilled.
69dd9823-6a49-4a61-92ca-b47d27b721ae Enjoy!
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 F.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Slice the croissant in half and heat in the oven.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Take a small non-stick frying pan and melt the pat of salted butter. Add the egg and cook, sunny-side up, over medium-low heat until the white is cooked through and the yolk is still runny. Sprinkle with a little bit of salt, remove from heat and set aside.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Take the croissant out of the oven and crumble half of the blueberry goat cheese onto the bottom half.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Add the turkey slices, bacon, fried egg, and the rest of the blueberry goat cheese.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Top with the remaining half of the croissant.
4389bbe3-9969-4b42-82ea-a8e94ed89e4c Serve immediately and enjoy!
41104f96-f0a9-4e8b-8e3e-901a8e1f7298 Preheat oven to 375 F.
41104f96-f0a9-4e8b-8e3e-901a8e1f7298 Wrap the beets in foil, place in a small baking dish, and bake for 1 hour, or until tender (test with a small knife). Allow to cool completely. When cool, scrape off the skin with a knife, and slice the beets as thin as possible; reserve.
41104f96-f0a9-4e8b-8e3e-901a8e1f7298 Fan the beet slices on four chilled salad plates. Top with the sliced pear and walnuts. In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar, olive oil, and walnut oil. Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste.
41104f96-f0a9-4e8b-8e3e-901a8e1f7298 Toss the arugula with a couple of tablespoons of the dressing, and divide on top of each salad. Top each plate with the goat cheese (grate finely if using firm, aged goat cheese, or simply crumble if using soft goat cheese).
41104f96-f0a9-4e8b-8e3e-901a8e1f7298 Drizzle each beet and pear salad with more of the dressing, serving an extra on the side. Serve immediately.
6addd03c-edb8-4519-9dc2-ddc541660fb4 Using a serrated knife, cut the small French baguette in half.
6addd03c-edb8-4519-9dc2-ddc541660fb4 Place the sandwich on parchment paper or butcher paper and drizzle the inside of the bread with olive oil.
6addd03c-edb8-4519-9dc2-ddc541660fb4 Add rosemary ham, the apple, and a drizzle of honey to one side.
6addd03c-edb8-4519-9dc2-ddc541660fb4 Add the arugula, the goat cheese and the juice from one lemon wedge to the other half and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
6addd03c-edb8-4519-9dc2-ddc541660fb4 Wrap the sandwich in butcher paper and either refrigerate until ready to eat or cut the sandwich down the middle and serve immediately.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc Gather the ingredients.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc With a spiralizer kitchen tool, spiralize two large zucchini into spaghetti-size noodles. If you don't have a spiralizer, you can use a julienne peeler instead.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc In a medium-sized skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook until softened, about 2 to 3 minutes.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 min.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc Add the corn, grape tomatoes, and basil. Season to taste with salt and pepper, stirring occasionally as you cook until heated through. When hot, turn off heat and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of crumbled goat cheese over top.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc In a separate large skillet, heat the remaining oil over medium-high heat. Add the zucchini noodles and toss as you cook (using tongs makes this easier). The zucchini noodles don't take long to cooktoss for about 3 to 4 minutes.
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc Then add in the corn, tomato, shallot, and cheese mixture. Toss to combine then remove the pan from heat. (Note: If you julienned the noodles, only cook for 2 to 3 minutes as these noodles are thinner and cook faster than spiralized noodles).
0add399c-1f90-4bf4-a763-eda37b17bdfc Divide noodle dish into two bowls, garnishing with remaining goat cheese and additional basil, if desired. Serve immediately.
7709a5fa-4daf-4823-884d-03d2baa096fb Preheat oven to 400 F
7709a5fa-4daf-4823-884d-03d2baa096fb If you are using store bought flatbread, brush the flatbread with olive oil and place on cookie sheets. Bake for five minutes, so it gets a little crispy.
7709a5fa-4daf-4823-884d-03d2baa096fb Remove from the oven and evenly cover with the sundried tomatoes, olives and dollops of the goat cheese. Bake for 5 minutes more, or until the flatbread is crisp around the edges and the cheese is warm and soft.
7709a5fa-4daf-4823-884d-03d2baa096fb If you are making your own flatbread, follow the flatbread recipe to make the dough then lightly oil two rimless baking sheets. Set one ball of dough on top of each baking sheet and roll the dough out as thin as possible (put a towel under the baking sheet to keep it from sliding while you roll the dough). The thinner the dough, the crispier the crust will be.
7709a5fa-4daf-4823-884d-03d2baa096fb Brush a tablespoon of olive oil on each piece of dough. Bake the dough for 15 minutes until it is fairly crispy and lightly browned. Remove from the oven and spread sundried tomatoes,olives and dollops of the goat cheese on top. Bake for another 10 minutes or so, until the crust is brown and crispy and the cheese is soft.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Preheat oven to 350 F. Set aside a deep lasagna oven safe dish.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Fill a large stockpot 2/3 full with cold water. Add 1 teaspoon of salt, cover with a lid, and bring to a rolling boil. Add 14 gluten-free lasagna noodles and boil for 13 to 14 minutes. (Do not overcook the noodles. They will continue to cook once the lasagna is baked in the oven).
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Drain and rinse the noodles in cold water. Pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil on the noodles and coat. This will prevent the noodles from sticking together as they cool.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Add onions, garlic and 3 tablespoons of olive oil to a large skillet. Sauté for two minutes.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Add the ground beef and 1 teaspoon salt. Brown meat over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until thoroughly cooked.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Pour the canned sauce over the beef mixture, add 1 tablespoon of the Italian seasonings, and all of the fennel. Stir to combine and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 In a medium-sized mixing bowl, blend goat cheese, ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, eggs, fresh basil, Italian parsley, fresh oregano, 1 teaspoon salt, and fresh cracked pepper.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Assemble lasagna: Spread 1 cup of the meat sauce mixture in the bottom of the baking dish. Overlap the edges of 4 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce. Evenly spread 1 cup of meat sauce over the noodles. Spread 1 cup of the cheese/herb mixture over meat sauce. Evenly sprinkle about 2 cups of shredded cheeses over this layer. Repeat layers (lasagna noodles/meat sauce/ cheese herb mixture/shredded cheese). Overlap 4 lasagna noodles on top, spread evenly with remaining meat sauce and top with remaining shredded cheese.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Sprinkle remaining 1 tablespoon of Italian herb blend evenly over the shredded cheese.
883fa3ee-cb94-45d5-926b-534e4ed8a7c3 Bake for 1 hour or until golden brown on top. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Gently heat the milk in a stainless steel pot until it reaches 86 F then turn off the heat.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Sprinkle the starter culture packet into the milk and stir a few times with the wooden spoon.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Cover the pot and let the milk culture for 12-18 hours. Cultures for health recommends culturing the milk in an environment that's as close to 73 degrees as possible. The milk will not culture properly in an environment that is too cool.
