4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 When the milk has properly cultured, it will have the consistency of yogurt. There will probably still be some liquid in the pot as well. This is the whey.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Drape the butter muslin or cheesecloth (double layers) over a colander. Gently pour or scoop the cheese into the colander. Pull the cloth up around the cheese and tie it into a little sack.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Hang the cheese up so it can drain. You can tie it to a wooden spoon or ladle and hang it over a deep bowl or pitcher. Cultures for Health recommends tying it to the handle of a cupboard and setting a bowl underneath.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 The cheese needs to drain for at least 6 hours, but the longer you let it drain the richer and denser the cheese will be. Twelve hours is often the right amount of time. Do not squeeze the cheese to get the moisture out; let it drain on its own.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Scrape the cheese out of the cloth and into a bowl. Add salt if desired.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 The goat cheese can also be flavored with chopped fresh herbs, dried spices or anything else you can think of.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 If you want to shape your goat cheese, try using a biscuit or cookie cutter with deep sides.
4b3d07e8-c47e-4f0b-8275-05e297d1a498 Kept refrigerated in an airtight container the goat cheese will keep up to one week.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Gather the ingredients and preheat grill for high heat.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Place a sheet of plastic wrap under and over the turkey, so that it's covered.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a With heavy pan or kitchen mallet, flatten turkey breast evenly.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Squeeze excess fluid from thawed spinach.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Coarsely chop and add to mushrooms, sunflower seeds, goat cheese, pepper, nutmeg, and eggs.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Remove turkey from plastic wrap and season with minced garlic and black pepper. Fill breast with stuffing and fold making sure to keep intact. Use twine or toothpick to keep breast closed. Top with bacon slices.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Place turkey breast on a roasting rack. Set over the burners that are not turned on. This will cook the turkey indirectly.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Close lid and let cook until internal temperatures reach between 160 to 165 F/70 to 75 C, usually about 20 minutes per pound.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Remove turkey breast from the grill, cover, and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes. Discard bacon, twine, or toothpicks.
f525a675-6636-4aaf-b7ad-98afcd3ec02a Serve and enjoy!
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Trim the lettuce leaves from the stalk, then wash and dry each leaf. If you use a salad spinner to dry your lettuce, you might find it easier to do so after you chop it.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Chop the lettuce into 1-inch pieces and transfer to a large salad bowl.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Slice the tomato into eight sections, then cut each section in half crossways, so that you have 16 chunks of tomato. Add them to the lettuce.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Halve the avocado and remove the pit. Then section the avocado much as you did the tomato. Add the avocado chunks to the lettuce and tomato.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Roughly crumble the goat cheese over the top.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Spoon a couple of tablespoons of dressing over the salad and gently toss. You want the dressing to lightly coat everything. Add more if you need to, and toss again.
5bf596fc-765b-4486-aa5b-60d4dc6c290b Once the salad is dressed, serve it right away.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Gather the ingredients.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Using either a stand or hand mixer, whip together the cream and sugar.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Beat in the yogurt, goat cheese, vanilla, and salt.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Pour equally into 4 jars or dessert glasses and refrigerate for about an hour to firm up.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Add the sugar, honey, salt, and water to a saucepan and heat on medium just until the sugar dissolves.
54df2ecd-8c56-481b-bdd9-332495d72595 Distribute the halved figs evenly into the 4 servings and pour the honey glaze over the figs.
76410d5b-ad80-4db1-8596-e5ee3173f2ed Gather the ingredients.
76410d5b-ad80-4db1-8596-e5ee3173f2ed Either by hand or using an electric mixer, whisk the cream until it has soft peaks and a texture that is similar to whipped cream. Set aside.
76410d5b-ad80-4db1-8596-e5ee3173f2ed In a separate bowl, whisk together goat cheese and milk until the goat cheese has softened. Mix in chives. Gently fold in whipped cream.
76410d5b-ad80-4db1-8596-e5ee3173f2ed Serve chilled with bread and/or crackers on the side.
a32ee82c-dbb9-4129-aad0-7065159f1852 In a medium bowl, beat together cheese and butter until smooth. Mix in remaining ingredients, adjusting the seasonings, if necessary, and refrigerate, covered, for at least 1 hour for the flavors to marry.
a32ee82c-dbb9-4129-aad0-7065159f1852 When ready to serve, let korozott come to room temperature before spreading on toasted or untoasted bread, or instead of mayo in a sandwich.
d12890f1-5e54-45c4-becd-366d940e1802 Prepare the dipping sauce: Place the guava paste in a small saucepan. Add the remaining ingredients (vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, and juice) and whisk together over low heat until the guava paste has completely melted. Remove from heat and set aside.
d12890f1-5e54-45c4-becd-366d940e1802 Prepare the cheese fritters: coarsely chop the green onions and place them in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse a couple of times for a few seconds each time, until the onions are more finely chopped. Add the goat cheese, the softened cream cheese, and the ricotta cheese to the food processor bowl. Add 2 eggs and the flour and process the mixture until it is well mixed. Add salt and pepper to taste, and pulse to mix. If desired, add one or more optional ingredients to the cheese mixture at this point, such as crumbled cooked bacon, crumbled blue cheese, grated manchego cheese, finely chopped sun-dried tomatoes, finely chopped olives, etc.
d12890f1-5e54-45c4-becd-366d940e1802 Chill the cheese mixture for at least an hour.
d12890f1-5e54-45c4-becd-366d940e1802 Once the cheese mixture is cold, shape the mixture into 1-inch diameter balls. Roll each ball in the breadcrumbs and thoroughly coat the cheese with the crumbs. Place the cheese balls on a baking sheet and keep them chilled until you are ready to fry them.
d12890f1-5e54-45c4-becd-366d940e1802 Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a deep skillet or saucepan to 350 F. Fry the cheese balls, in batches, until they are very golden brown. Carefully remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels. Serve cheese fritters warm, with the dipping sauce. If you are not going to serve the fried fritters right away, keep them warm in a 200 F oven until ready to serve.
e1341423-6f89-486c-aa97-e29332a9299e Gather the ingredients.
e1341423-6f89-486c-aa97-e29332a9299e Drain tomatoes, reserving 2 teaspoons of the oil. Chop tomatoes and set aside.
e1341423-6f89-486c-aa97-e29332a9299e In a large bowl stir reserved oil, goat cheese, sesame seeds, and garlic until well combined. Stir in beans, tomatoes, and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
e1341423-6f89-486c-aa97-e29332a9299e Serve with warm or cold pita wedges.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 Cut off the greens from the beets, and then trim the beets. Very young and tender beets can be scrubbed clean, but you will want to peel most beets. Cut the beets in half lengthwise, lay them cut-side flat and cut them into 1/4-inch-thick slices.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 Heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon of the olive oil, 1/4 cup of water, and the beets. Cover and cook until the beets are just barely tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 While the beets start to cook, rinse the beet leaves and cut out their thick stems (cut a "v" into the leaf to remove the thick stem while saving most of the tender leaf around it. Trim the stems and cut them into about 2-inch lengths. When the beets are just starting to seem tender, add the stems to the pan. Cover and let cook until the beets and beet stems are tender, about 3 minutes.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 Meanwhile, chop the leaves and set them aside. Peel and thinly slice the garlic.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 Add the garlic to the pan, cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the chopped beet greens, cover, and cook until the leaves are wilted about 1 minute.
362d1657-5361-4a29-9bf2-9bdb13bf35b7 Divide the warm salad between 4 plates. Spoon any pan liquids evenly over each serving. Drizzle each salad with the remaining olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Add any optional garnishes (lemon zest, orange zest, hazelnuts, feta, goat cheese) that you like.
f05cd002-378f-40ee-9d83-28d093173b89 Preheat the oven to 400 F and butter a 13" x 9" baking dish. Bring a large pot of water to boil for the pasta.
f05cd002-378f-40ee-9d83-28d093173b89 Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan and reduce to 3/4 cup over high heat. Bring the cream to a boil in another large heavy saucepan and reduce it to 1-1/2 cups. Both of these processes should take about 10 minutes.
f05cd002-378f-40ee-9d83-28d093173b89 Melt the butter and olive oil in another large heavy saucepan and cook the onions and garlic until translucent and tender. Cook the pasta until al dente and drain.
f05cd002-378f-40ee-9d83-28d093173b89 Add the reduced cream and reduced broth to the onions, then add the mustard, cheddar, Gouda, Gruyere, and Brie cheeses and whisk until melted and blended. Add the seasonings. Add the pasta and mix well.
f05cd002-378f-40ee-9d83-28d093173b89 Spoon into the prepared baking dish. In a small bowl, mix bread crumbs, 3 tablespoons melted butter and Parmesan cheese; sprinkle over casserole. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes until the top browns and casserole are bubbly.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Gather the ingredients. Heat the oven to 350 F / 175 C / Gas Mark 4.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Peel, rinse, and dry the potatoes and slice as thinly as possible (a mandoline is good for this, but a sharp knife works too).
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac In a large saucepan, place the potatoes, milk, cream, 1 of the crushed garlic cloves, salt to taste, along with a dash pepper and nutmeg (or mace).
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Bring to a very gentle boil and simmer for a few minutes until the cream thickens.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Remove from the heat and add the grated Gruyère. Stir until the cheese has melted.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Generously grease an ovenproof dish with 1 teaspoon of the butter, then rub the dish all over with the remaining lightly crushed clove of garlic.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Pour the potato mixture into the dish, using a spoon to gently move the potatoes in the cream mixture to make sure they are all covered.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Finely slice the brie into long strips and lay across the top of the gratin. Dot the surface with the remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Season with salt and pepper.
b6c944a3-722d-467e-a447-0105d71d80ac Bake for about 40 minutes or until the top is bubbly and golden brown and the potatoes are soft when pierced with a knife. If the top is browning too quickly before the potatoes are cooked, cover with aluminum foil. Serve immediately. Enjoy.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Gather the ingredients.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Smear each slice of bread with cranberry jam.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Add the slices of roasted turkey breast, spinach (trying to pack it down as much as possible), and brie to one half of the bread.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Top the sandwich with the other piece of bread.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Take a rectangle-sized sheet of wax paper or butcher paper and put the sandwich in the middle.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Pull up two sides above the middle of the sandwich and roll down towards the sandwich until it's snug.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Take the other two sides of the paper and fold them under the sandwich.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e With a very sharp serrated knife, slice down the middle of the sandwich to separate the two halves.
01a38c59-d253-4330-97a6-bbfa7b0d061e Serve and enjoy!
8c5b4313-b6a8-4998-b222-1d4cfb9d511e Gather the ingredients.
8c5b4313-b6a8-4998-b222-1d4cfb9d511e Spread the butter evenly on the cut sides of the ciabatta bread, or drizzle with the same amount of olive oil if you aren't going to toast the sandwich.
8c5b4313-b6a8-4998-b222-1d4cfb9d511e Toast the bread halves in a toaster oven or bake them in a 375 F oven for 7 to 11 minutes or until the butter melts and starts to sizzle.
8c5b4313-b6a8-4998-b222-1d4cfb9d511e Arrange the Brie cheese slices on the top half of the ciabatta bread; toast again until the Brie melts, or bake for another 4 to 6 minutes.
8c5b4313-b6a8-4998-b222-1d4cfb9d511e Make sandwiches with the basil leaves, tomato slices, and the toasted bread. Put the sandwich together, then cut into 3-inch segments. Press down lightly with your hand and serve immediately.
adece2eb-20ea-4fc9-8137-4f8f4956e532 Gather the ingredients.
adece2eb-20ea-4fc9-8137-4f8f4956e532 Heat oven to 350 F.
adece2eb-20ea-4fc9-8137-4f8f4956e532 In a heavy saucepan, heat brown sugar and butter over medium heat until smooth and thickened. Remove from heat. Add cinnamon, nutmeg, and amaretto. Mix well.
adece2eb-20ea-4fc9-8137-4f8f4956e532 Place Brie in an oven-safe casserole dish. Top with sauce and sprinkle with almonds or walnuts. Bake 10 to 15 minutes until Brie is soft. (Instead of baking, you may microwave Brie at 30-second intervals until soft and warm.)
adece2eb-20ea-4fc9-8137-4f8f4956e532 Serve with baguette slices, toast rounds, crostini, crackers, or sliced apples.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Gather the ingredients.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Put the goat meat with the garlic and ginger pastes in a large bowl and mix well to coat the meat with the pastes. Set aside for 20 minutes.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d While the meat is marinating, heat 3 tablespoons cooking oil in a large, deep pot or pan over medium heat. Add the finely chopped onions and fry until translucent.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Add the curry leaves and green chilies, if using, and fry for 1 minute.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Add the powdered spices (coriander, cumin, turmeric, and garam masala) and salt to taste and mix well and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir often to prevent burning.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Add the marinated meat. Stir well and often and cook until the meat is browned.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Add 1 1/2 cups of hot water, stir, cover, and simmer until meat is tender. Keep checking at this stage as you do not want the meat overcooked and soft.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d While the meat is cooking, make the tamarind puree. Put the tamarind in a plastic or glass bowl and pour 1/2 cup of hot water over it. Allow the mixture to stand for 5 to 10 minutes. Strain the tamarind and water mixture through a sieve (do not use a very fine sieve) into a bowl to get tamarind puree. Add this to the curry when you feel the meat is almost done. Stir well. Once the meat is cooked, set it aside and prepare the rice.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Put the rice in a colander and wash under running water until the water runs clear. Place in a large, deep cooking pot (preferably one with handles).
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Add enough water to fully cover the rice, usually at least 4 inches over the surface of the rice. Add 1 teaspoon of salt (or to taste). Bring the rice to a boil. Cook until almost done. (To determine when it has reached that stage, remove a few grains from the pot and press between your thumb and forefinger. The rice should mostly mash but will have a firm, whitish core.) Turn off the heat and strain through a colander and set aside.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan and fry the thinly sliced onions until caramelized and golden brown. Drain and set aside on paper towels for later use.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d If you are using the food coloring, divide the rice into 3 equal portions and put into separate dishes. Add the orange food coloring to one portion of the rice and the green food coloring to another portion of the rice. Leave the third portion white. With each portion, mix the rice until all the grains are well colored. Set aside for 10 minutes and then mix all 3 portions of rice together in a bowl.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Preheat the oven or grill to 350 F/180 C and grease a deep dish or pot (which has a well-fitting cover).
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Evenly layer the cooked rice and the meat (with its gravy) in the dish to form at least two sets of layers (rice-meat-rice-meat-rice). Garnish with the caramelized onions. Cover the dish tightly. If your dish does not have a cover use two layers of aluminum foil (shiny side of both layers facing down toward the rice) and secure onto a dish with baking string. If you are using a handi (a deep pot with a nicely fitting lid) which has a flat rim, you can seal it by making a firm dough with flour and water and pressing this over the joint of the handi's rim and cover.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Place the dish in the oven or grill and cook for 20 minutes.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Turn off the oven or barbecue and let the dish sit in the oven or barbecue until you are ready to eat. It's important that you only open when you are ready to serve. The way to serve biryani is to gently dig in with a spoon so you get through the layers.
aa23eabb-4178-45d9-b599-cf255765987d Serve and enjoy.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Gather the ingredients.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Bring the water to boil in a medium saucepan. Add the salt and butter and allow the butter to melt.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a When the water has returned to a boil, stir in the rice. Let the water return to a light simmer.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Stir again, cover the pot, and turn the heat down to low. Keep the rice simmering slightly, and keep the pot covered (you may have to peek after a few minutes to make sure the heat is at the correct temperature, but then let it cook, covered).
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Start checking to see if the rice is tender and all of the liquid is absorbed in about 17 minutes. It may take up to 25, especially if you are making a larger quantity of rice.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a When the rice is cooked, turn off the heat and let it sit for another couple of minutes to finish absorbing any liquid.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Take off the lid, fluff the rice with a fork, and let it sit for another 2 minutes so that some of the excess moisture in the rice dries off.
62d80972-db1b-4a39-8e7d-b1dfb59f976a Serve with your side of protein and enjoy!
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Gather the ingredients.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Cut tops off peppers; remove seeds and membranes. Chop edible part of tops and set aside. Rinse peppers under cold water. Place peppers in a large pot; cover with salted water. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain peppers and set aside.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Heat olive oil in a large skillet or sauté pan over medium heat until hot. Sauté chopped green pepper (from tops), chopped onion, and chopped celery for about 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, crushed garlic, basil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Preheat oven to 350 F.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 In a large mixing bowl, combine the beaten egg with remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Gently stir to blend; add ground beef, cooked rice, and 1 cup of the tomato mixture. Mix well.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Stuff peppers with meat mixture and place in a 3-quart baking dish. Pour remaining tomato mixture over the stuffed peppers.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Bake in preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the meat mixture is fully cooked. The temperature of the meat mixture should be cooked to a minimum of 160 F.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Top stuffed peppers with a little shredded cheddar cheese just before they are done; bake until cheese is melted.
263cd2de-4ff3-4fb2-8b40-b8a49d23d1d2 Serve and enjoy!
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 Gather the ingredients.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 In a blender or food processor, combine all of the marinade ingredients until completely smooth.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 Add both the marinade and chicken to a bowl with a lid. Refrigerate for at least an hour or for a maximum of four hours. If you marinate for too long, the lime juice will actually start to cook the chicken.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 When you're ready to cook the chicken, heat your grill pan on high heat.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 Sear the chicken on both sides, then turn the heat to medium-low and cook until the juices run clear, or the internal temperature reaches 165 F.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 Remove the chicken from the grill pan and turn off the heat. Allow the chicken to rest for at least 5 minutes.
0c809ee0-19f1-43b7-99d9-0c7f3a496c17 Then chop the chicken to your desired size and serve it on top of the rice along with any of the other toppings, like salsa, guacamole, beans, and shredded cheese.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Gather the ingredients.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Put the almonds in a bowl of hot water (enough to cover them) and set aside for 10 minutes.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c After 10 minutes, remove the skins from all the almonds by pressing each one between your thumb and forefinger. The almonds will slip out of their skins.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Mix the garlic and ginger pastes and the peeled almonds and grind the mixture into a smooth paste in a food processor.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Wash the rice in a sieve and add enough water to fully cover the riceat least 4 inches over the surface of the rice. Add salt to taste.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Boil the rice until it is almost done. To determine when the rice has reached that stage, remove a few grains from the pot and press them between your thumb and forefinger. The rice should mostly mash but will have a firm, white core. Turn off the burner.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Strain the rice through a colander and set it aside.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan and fry two of the onions until they are caramelized and golden brown. Drain and set the onions aside on paper towels.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in another pan and add the whole spicescinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and peppercorns. Fry the mixture until the spices turn a little darker.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Add the two remaining onions and fry them until they are translucent.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Add the ginger-garlic-almond paste and fry for two to three minutes.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Add all the spice powderscoriander, cumin, and garam masala and mix well.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Fry the mixture until the oil begins to separate from the masala and then add the lamb or chicken. Continue frying until the meat is fully sealed; it will become opaque and lose its pink color.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Add the yogurt, lime juice, stock, coriander and mint leaves and salt to taste (if needed). Mix well.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Cover the pot and allow the dish to cook until the meat is tender.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c If you are using food coloring, divide the rice into three equal portions and put each portion into a separate dish. Add the orange food coloring to one portion of the rice and the green food coloring to another portion. Leave the third portion white.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c With each portion, mix the rice until all the grains are well colored.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Set the rice aside for 10 minutes, and then mix the three portions in a bowl.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Grease a deep baking dish and evenly layer the cooked rice and meat (and its gravy) to form at least two sets of layersrice-meat-rice-meat-rice. Garnish with the previously caramelized onions.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Cover the dish tightly. If the dish does not have a cover, use two layers of aluminum foil with the shiny side of both layers pointing down toward the rice, and secure the foil to the dish with baking string.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Put the dish in a preheated oven set at 350 F. Bake for 20 minutes.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Turn off the oven and let the dish sit in the oven until you are ready to eat. Remove the foil only when you are ready to eat.
95d31c07-9f14-4789-8409-f4909cbcf99c Serve and enjoy!
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Gather the ingredients.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Put the dried beans in a bowl of cold water and swish them around to rinse. Discard floating beans.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Drain the beans in a colander and pick them over, looking for any small stones or malformed beans.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Put the beans in the crockery insert of a slow cooker.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Add 1 1/2 quarts of water to the beans along with the celery, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and crushed red pepper flakes.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Cover the slow cooker and cook the beans on LOW for about 6 to 7 hours, or until the beans are tender. Or cook them for about 3 1/2 to 5 hours on HIGH.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced andouille sausage and cook, stirring, until the sausage is nicely browned.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Add the sausage and bell pepper to the beans. Taste and add 2 to 3 teaspoons of Kosher salt, or to taste.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Cover and continue cooking on LOW for about 1 hour longer.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Meanwhile, cook the rice in a rice cooker or on the stovetop following package directions.
1f38c2e2-a435-4b5f-bc6d-c7239cb40a0f Mound the rice on a plate or in a bowl, ladle the beans over the rice, and serve with freshly baked cornbread.
f75f9f5e-07d0-41cb-bcc1-e786adbd1629 Place a 2/3 cup of cooked rice in a small rice bowl. If using leftover rice, reheat the rice in the microwave first.
f75f9f5e-07d0-41cb-bcc1-e786adbd1629 Add a 1/4 cup of grilled salmon and desired garnishes.
f75f9f5e-07d0-41cb-bcc1-e786adbd1629 Pour a 1/2 to 2/3 cup of hot brewed green tea over the rice, salmon, and garnishes.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Gather the ingredients.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Bring 8 cups of water to a boil in a large pot, and add the juice of 1/2 lemon and the salt. Carefully unroll the leaves (do not separate them). Turn off the heat and place the leaves in the hot water for 3 minutes.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Remove the leaves and place them in a bowl and cover with cold water. When cooled, drain in a colander. It is not unusual for many of the outer leaves in the jar to be damaged or to tear while using. Set these aside to use later in the recipe.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 To prepare the filling, start by soaking the rice for 10 minutes in hot water and drain. (Alternatively, sauté the rice with the onion.)
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Sauté the onions in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until translucent, not browned.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 In a bowl, combine the onion, ground beef, rice, remaining olive oil, dill, mint, juice of 1 lemon, and pepper. Mix well by hand.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 To fill and roll the leaves, gently separate one leaf and place it shiny-side down on a work surface. Place a pinch (up to a teaspoon) of the filling on the leaf at the point where the stem joins the leaf.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Fold up the bottom of the leaf over the filling, then each side inward in parallel folds, and roll up the leaf. The roll should be firm, not tight, as the filling will expand during cooking. Repeat until all the filling has been used.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Because the leaves on the bottom can burn while the filling cooks, put a plate or wooden souvlaki skewers in the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot (see tip below). The plate should fit snugly in the pot.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 If there are unused leaves or leaves that were torn and not used during the filling process, put them on the plate or on top of the skewers. Place the dolmathakia on top, packing them closely together (not squashed), seam side down, so they don't unroll during cooking. Layer them until all are in the pot (two to three layers are best, but no more than four layers). Place several unused leaves over the top.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Take another plate and place it upside down on top of the dolmathakia, using something to weigh it down (a second plate works well). Add the 2 cups of water to the pot and cover. Bring the water to a gentle boil, add the remaining juice from the 1 1/2 lemons, reduce heat to low and simmer for approximately 50 to 70 minutes. Check to see if doneif the rice has cooked, they are done. If not, continue cooking for another 10 minutes and check again. Cooking time depends both on the type of pot used and the particular stovetop heating element.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 If preferred, you can use a pressure cooker. No plates are needed but do use the skewers in the bottom. Pack the dolmathakia into the pressure cooker, add the 2 cups of water, close and cook for 15 to 20 minutes at the first pressure mark.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 If you don't have skewers or a plate that fits the bottom of the pot, line the bottom of the pan with unused or torn leaves.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 Leftover filling can be used to make stuffed vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, zucchini, and eggplant.
633136f4-00c3-44d7-a5ce-53272f926174 To make stuffed grape leaves as a main course, use larger grape leaves and increase the amount of filling in each leaf to 1 tablespoon.
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Gather the ingredients.
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Spray the slow cooker stoneware with cooking spray.
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Combine all ingredients in the slow cooker.
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Cook on HIGH 2 to 3 hours or LOW 4 to 5 hours (follow the directions for your slow cooker, as they may vary depending on the model)
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Serve warm and add toppings if desired.
79b8a410-945e-4621-a81b-33686727d0fd Enjoy!
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Place rice, stock, and olive oil in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover, cooking for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and add the butter and parmesan cheese. Stir and add more broth if it is too dry. Cover and let sit off of the heat for 10 minutes. Allow the rice to cool to room temperature before beginning to make the arancini. You can make the risotto ahead of time and store in the refrigerator until you are ready to assemble.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Take a golf ball sized scoop of risotto rice, make a well in the center and place the cheese inside. Wrap the rice around the piece of cheese and place on a parchment lined baking tray. Repeat with remaining rice and cheese.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Freeze the balls on the baking tray for 2-3 hours or overnight.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Place the flour in a low dish, add 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Place eggs in another low dish with the milk. Whisk together and add a 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Place the breadcrumbs in another low dish and add 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Dip the rice ball into the flour mixture and coat. Then dip into the egg mixture and coat. Then dip it into the Panko bread crumbs and roll to coat completely. Repeat with the remaining rice balls.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed, deep pot on high until it is about 375 F. Turn it down to medium heat and add in a few rice balls at a time to cook.
fd0ddff6-207a-4e3c-8e79-14741ec65ab3 Rotate them in the oil as they are cooking to ensure browning on all sides. Remove the rice balls from the oil when they are golden brown. Place the rice balls on another parchment lined baking dish and keep in a 250 F oven while cooking the remaining arancini.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Put the whole squash in a large stock pot and fill it with water to cover by at least an inch. Bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat just enough to maintain a moderate boil without overflow and cook the squash until they feel fork tender, about 15 to 20 minutes, depending on size.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Heat the oven to 350 F. Line a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with foil and spray it with nonstick cooking spray.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Heat the olive oil in a medium sauce pot or large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the green onions and garlic, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Add the chicken broth and bring it to a boil.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Add the rice, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and the pepper. Reduce the heat, cover the pot, and simmer the rice for 20 minutes, or until the grains absorb the liquid and turn tender.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Add the 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and spinach, stirring until the spinach wilts. Set it aside.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Cut the tops off the squash and scoop out some of the insides to make room for the rice, being careful not to break through the sides or bottom of the squash.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Mound some of the rice mixture into each squash using a spoon or cookie scoop. Arrange them in the prepared baking pan.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Sprinkle each stuffed squash lightly with salt and pepper and sprinkle a little more Parmesan cheese over the top of each one.
da975d7e-9cf7-40c5-8189-532aca360abd Bake the squash in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes until heated through and the cheese turns lightly brown.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Gather the ingredients.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Cut the tops off of the bell peppers and rinse them under cold water; remove seeds and cut away the white ribs, which might be bitter. Chop the edible part of tops and set aside. Place the peppers in a large pot and cover with salted water.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat until oil is hot and the butter is foamy. Sauté the chopped bell pepper (from the tops), chopped onion, and chopped celery for about 5 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Add the (undrained) canned diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, crushed garlic, oregano, basil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg with the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Gently stir to blend; add ground beef, cooked rice, and 1 cup of the tomato sauce mixture. Mix well.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Heat the oven to 350 F.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Stuff the peppers loosely with the ground beef mixture and place them in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Pour the remaining tomato mixture over the stuffed peppers.
b085cc99-9641-40f8-9d00-94cb4bc67198 Bake the peppers for about 45 minutes, or until the meat mixture is thoroughly cooked.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Gather the ingredients.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd In a medium-sized saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the fresh onion and sauté for 1 or 2 minutes until softened and translucent.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Add the dry rice and continue sautéeing, stirring frequently, for about 5 minutes or until rice becomes a golden brown color. Do not allow the rice to burn.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Add the garlic to the rice and sauté for one more minute.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Take the pan off the heat; add the chicken broth and tomato sauce, plus the parsley and/or vegetables, if using. Stir, return pan to heat and bring to a boil. Turn the heat to low and cover.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Let simmer for 20 minutes without taking the lid off. After 20 minutes, remove the lid and carefully insert a spoon into the cooked rice. (If the bottom of the pan is dry, your rice is done; if there is still some broth visible, allow it to cook for a few more minutes.)
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Once the rice is done cooking, remove it from the heat and let it sit, covered and undisturbed, for another 10 minutes or so.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Fluff your rice with a fork before serving. Use your delicious homemade rice as a side for almost any savory Mexican dish.
992e1ef0-e99e-4286-8883-83b95c4aa1dd Serve and enjoy!
4b298274-b0ad-4fdc-ab59-d2832cbc5ac5 In a large Dutch oven or large saucepan, combine the black-eyed peas, ham bone or ham hocks, and 6 cups water. Cut 1 of the onions in half and add it to the pot along with the garlic halves and bay leaf. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer gently until the beans are tender but not too soft and mushy, 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
4b298274-b0ad-4fdc-ab59-d2832cbc5ac5 Remove the ham bone or hocks, cut off the meat; dice and set aside. Drain the peas and set aside. Remove and discard the bay leaf, onion pieces, and garlic.
4b298274-b0ad-4fdc-ab59-d2832cbc5ac5 Add 2 1/2 cups of water to the pot and bring to a boil. Add the rice, cover, and simmer until the rice is almost tender about 10 to 12 minutes.
4b298274-b0ad-4fdc-ab59-d2832cbc5ac5 Mince the remaining onion then add to the rice along with the peas, tomatoes, and their juices, red and green bell pepper, celery, jalapeno pepper, Creole seasoning, thyme, cumin, and salt. Cook until the rice is tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in the sliced green onions and the reserved diced ham.
9060cb69-a251-440b-b84d-50bf24e329d1 Gather the ingredients.
9060cb69-a251-440b-b84d-50bf24e329d1 Rinse the rice until the water runs clear. Drain in a colander and set aside.
9060cb69-a251-440b-b84d-50bf24e329d1 In a medium saucepan, bring the 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the salt, stir, and then add the rinsed and drained rice. Stir with a fork.
9060cb69-a251-440b-b84d-50bf24e329d1 Reduce the heat, cover the rice, and let it simmer for 20 minutes. Check it after 15 minutes to see if all the water has evaporated. If it has, the rice is ready. If not, replace the lid and let the rice simmer an additional 5 minutes.
9060cb69-a251-440b-b84d-50bf24e329d1 Remove from the heat, fluff with a fork, and transfer into a serving dish.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Gather the ingredients.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Gently roast and then coarsely grind the coriander seeds into powder. Set aside.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilis. Fry the mixture until the splattering stops.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Add the ginger and peanuts. Fry the mixture for another minute.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Add the turmeric powder and turn off the burner.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Add the lemon juice and mix well.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Add the rice, roasted coriander powder, and salt to taste and mix thoroughly.
b69a760b-d70f-4587-98de-2151d5db80ad Enjoy!
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Put the rich in a fine sieve and wash under running water till the water runs clear. Now put the rice into a deep bowl and fill the bowl with enough warm water to fully cover the rice. Soak for 30 minutes.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a After soaking, put the rice in a deep pot and add enough water to cover the rice and 2" above it. Cook the rice on medium heat until almost done - to test, squeeze a few grains between thumb and index finger. They will be squishy but will not fully mash. Drain the almost cooked rice through a sieve and keep aside.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Marinate the prawns in a deep, non-metallic bowl, by adding the yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric powder, ginger and garlic pastes and salt to taste. Mix well and set aside for at least 1 hour.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Heat a griddle or flat pan on a medium flame and gently roast all ingredients mentioned under 'For dry masala/ spice mix' till they start to become slightly darker and give off a faint aroma.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Peel the cardamom pods and remove seeds. Throw skins away. Now grind all the roasted ingredients to a fine powder in a clean, dry coffee grinder.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Grind the ingredients mentioned under "For wet masala" to a smooth paste in a food processor.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan till hot and then fry 1 of the 3 portions of sliced onions until crispy and golden. When done, drain and remove from the oil and keep aside on paper towels to garnish biryani later.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a In the same oil, add the remaining sliced onions and fry till soft. Now add the tomatoes and fry till soft.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Add all the dry and wet masala ingredients prepared earlier and fry till the oil begins to separate from the whole mix.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Now add the prawns and all the marinade to this spice mix. Stir and allow to cook till the prawns are done. Do not overcook as the prawns will get rubbery in texture. Season with salt if required. Remove from fire.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Soak the saffron strands in 2 to 3 tbsp. of warm milk.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Take a large, deep ovenproof baking dish (it MUST have its own oven-proof cover) and grease lightly with cooking oil. Layer the rice and prawn as follows: rice - prawn - rice. End with a layer of rice. Keep a few prawns aside to garnish at the end.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Pour the saffron infused milk all over the top of the last layer of rice.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Garnish with the crispy fried onions, chopped coriander leaves. Cover the dish and seal tightly.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Bake in a 350 F oven for 30 minutes.
3abf0d9d-40d6-4dfa-a938-29f88c8c5a3a Serve hot with a raita and green salad of your choice.
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 Select an amount of rice depending on whether you are cooking for two or more. Wash brown rice well and drain until water runs almost clear. Allow rice to soak for 30 minutes, time permitting. Cook rice according to your rice cooker's instructions.
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 While the rice is cooking, cook frozen shelled edamame in boiling water for about 5 minutes until the beans are tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 After the rice is done cooking, allow it to rest in the rice cooker for about 15 minutes. Transfer the rice to a large shallow wooden sushi dish (or Japanese "oke").
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 Gently incorporate the Wakame-Chazuke (Green Tea) Furikake seasoning with the rice. If available, use a Japanese "shamoji" or rice paddle for ease of use.
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 Add the bottled Nametake (seasoned mushrooms) to the rice and gently mix.
215a8fbb-e33c-4c32-bbb2-08a822bbfca4 Add the cooked shelled edamame. Serve immediately.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e Gather the ingredients.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e Heat the oven to 350 F.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e In a large bowl, combine the ground beef with the rice, the water, chopped onion, seasoned salt, garlic powder, and pepper.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e Shape the ground beef mixture into 1 1/2-inch balls. Use a tablespoon or small cookie scoop to help make them uniform in size. (Or you can weigh them as you shape them.) Place them in an ungreased 2-quart shallow baking dish.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e Make the sauce by mixing together the tomato sauce, the water, and Worcestershire sauce in a measuring cup or bowl.
bf8a454c-07e5-4025-ac3f-52933a53437e Now it's time to cook the meatballs. Continue reading for the oven method, or scroll down to the stovetop method.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Gather the ingredients.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Heat the extra virgin olive oil (or annatto/achiote oil if using) in a pot over medium heat.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e When hot enough, add the sofrito and saute lightly until fragrant, about 1 or 2 minutes.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Add the sazón packet (if using), Spanish Manzanilla olives, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Stir the mixture to combine the ingredients.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e When the mixture starts to bubble, add the corn kernels and rice.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Thoroughly stir the mixture again to coat the rice and corn with color.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Slowly pour in the water (or chicken stock), while stirring.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Bring the ingredients to a rolling boil.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Allow it to boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then stir the rice mixture again.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Reduce the heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Continue to cook over low heat for 30 minutes.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Remove the lid and fluff the rice.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Then cover again, remove from the heat, and let it sit a few minutes more before serving.
ba7c072e-6646-435d-8ca1-061ddcac870e Enjoy!
1b23d013-2268-449b-9d75-b2519cd35c81 Gather the ingredients.
1b23d013-2268-449b-9d75-b2519cd35c81 Heat the broth to nearly boiling, then hold warm over low heat.
1b23d013-2268-449b-9d75-b2519cd35c81 In a deep skillet or heavy bottomed pot placed over medium heat, saute the rice, onions and peppers in the oil. When the rice begins to brown, add the garlic and tomatoes. Cook for several minutes, stirring frequently.
1b23d013-2268-449b-9d75-b2519cd35c81 Add the broth, tomato paste, cilantro and spices. Bring the liquids to a boil then reduce the heat, cover the pan, and simmer gently for 25 to 30 minutes without stirring, until the rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquids.
1b23d013-2268-449b-9d75-b2519cd35c81 Remove the rice from the heat and lightly stir with a fork to fluff the rice and mix the vegetables throughout. It should still be a little saucy; if not, gently mix in a few tablespoons of hot water. Cover and leave the rice sit for at least five minutes before serving.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Steam rice according to your rice cooker's instructions or on the stovetop.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d While the rice is cooking, boil green beans and slice on the diagonal into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d In a small bowl scramble eggs and add a pinch of salt. Heat medium size pan with olive oil and cook a thin layer of egg to make kinshi tamago (thin omelet). Remove from pan and let cool on cutting board. Cut into thin strips and set aside.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Boil a small pot of water to cook the baby broccolini.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Thaw cooked frozen shrimp, remove tails if desired, and then slice in half vertically to create 6 halved pieces of shrimp. Set aside.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Mix in sushi rice vinegar powder with cooked rice. You may or may not use all of the cooked rice, as it will depend on how thick you make your rice layers, as well as the diameter of the cake pan. Be sure to use diagonal cutting motions with the side edge of the rice paddle (pre-moistened with water) to mix with the warm rice. This helps to prevent the rice from getting mashed.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Line cake pan with a large sheet of plastic wrap. It will help you to remove the sushi with ease. If you are using a springform pan (with removable bottom), there's no need to line the pan with plastic wrap, but instead, make sure the pan is wet with water, to prevent the rice from sticking too much from the side of the pan.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Add a layer of rice on the bottom of the pan. Top with pink sakura denbu shredded codfish. Layer more rice on top and then garnish with sliced green beans. Layer with the last layer of rice. Garnish top with thinly sliced egg, baby broccolini, shrimp, ikura (salmon roe caviar), and any optional garnishes.
dc9f3107-cada-455e-a690-e5977253b23d Remove from pan onto a plate and serve immediately.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 One hour ahead of time, prepare the rice and lotus leaves. Soak the lotus leaves in hot water for 1 hour. Pat dry. Cover the rice with water and let soak for 1 hour. Drain.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Next, steam the rice. Line a bamboo steamer with parchment paper or cabbage leaf. Fill a wok approximately to the halfway point with water so that the steamer will be sitting above the water without touching. Bring the water to a boil cover the rice and steam for about 20 minutes. Remove the rice, cover and keep warm while preparing the remainder of the ingredients.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Soften the dried mushrooms by soaking in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Squeeze out any excess water, remove the stems and finely chop.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Cut the chicken into small cubes about the size of a postage stamp. Add the salt, 1 tablespoon rice wine and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. Marinate the chicken for 20 minutes.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Finely chop the sausages. Peel and chop the garlic. In a small bowl, combine the rice wine, light soy, and dark soy sauce. In a separate small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and whisk into the sauce.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Heat a wok and add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and stir-fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds). Add the chicken cubes. Stir-fry until they turn white and are 80 percent cooked through.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Add the sausages and the mushrooms. Stir-fry for a minute. Give the sauce mixture a quick re-stir then add in the middle, stirring quickly to thicken. Season with pepper to taste. Cook for 1 to 2 more minutes to mix everything together and heat through. Remove from the heat and stir in the sesame oil. Cool.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 To make the wraps, separate the rice and the filling into 8 equal sections, 1 section for each wrap. Lay a lotus leaf in front of you. Place a portion of the rice mixture into the center of a lotus leaf. Add the meat and vegetable mixture over top, shaping the rice with your hands so that it forms a ring around the filling. Add more rice to cover.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Form a square parcel with the lotus leaf and tie it up with twine. Repeat with the remaining lotus leaves.
1e088ded-af8d-4892-9090-de4c03465ba8 Steam the lotus leaf parcels, covered, on a heatproof plate in a bamboo steamer for 15 minutes, or until they are done.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Gather the ingredients.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Put all the ingredients (including garam masala powder) for the marinade into a large non-metallic bowl and mix until a smooth marinade is formed and all the ingredients are well blended.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Add the goat meat pieces and stir to coat every piece well. Cling warp the bowl and keep in the fridge to marinate for an hour.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan/ pot and add when hot, add the onions. Sauté until the onions begin to turn a pale golden color. Now add the ginger and garlic pastes and sauté for a minute. This will splutter at first so be careful while you stir.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Add the khus-khus (poppy seed), coconut, cashew powders and sauté for another 1-2 minutes, stirring continuously to avoid burning.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Add the tomato paste you made earlier and sauté for a minute.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Now add the marinated goat meat and the marinade to the pot and stir well to mix everything.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Cover and cook until the goat meat is three-quarters cooked.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea While the meat is cooking, prepare the rice. To do this, wash the rice thoroughly under running water till the water runs clear. Now put into a deep pot and add enough water to submerge the rice and go 2-inch over its surface. Cook the rice on medium heat until it is almost done. To test, just squeeze a grain between your thumb and index finger. There should still be a uncooked white core at the center when you do this. When the rid dis done, drain it in a colander and keep aside for later.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea If you are using the food coloring, divide the cooled rice into 3 equal portions and put into separate dishes. Add the orange food coloring to one portion of the rice and the green food coloring to another portion of the rice. Leave the third portion white. With each portion, mix the rice till all the grains are well colored. Keep aside for 10 minutes after which you can mix all 3 portions of rice together in a bowl for use in the next step.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Soak the strands of saffron in the warm milk.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Pre-heat your oven to 350 F/ 180 C/ Gas mark 4.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Grease a deep baking dish and add a layer of the cooked rice to the bottom. Now add half the goat meat (and its gravy) on top of the rice. Add another layer of rice, another layer of meat and then the last layer of rice (rice-meat-rice-meat-rice.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Garnish with the ghee and the saffron and milk mixture by drizzling all over the top.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Cover the dish tightly. If your dish does not have a cover tightly with foil and place another same-sized baking pan over it.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Bake for 20 minutes in preheated oven.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Turn off the oven and let the dish sit in the oven till you are ready to eat. Only open when you are ready to eat. The way to serve Biryani is to gently dig in with a spoon so you get through the layers.
a6894f6a-915c-4f57-9ee8-0f395bc912ea Serve with Raita and Kachumbar salad.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Cut the tops off peppers, dice tops only, and set aside. Remove seeds and membranes from peppers. Try not to pierce pepper flesh as this will prevent juices from leaking out during baking.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Blanche peppers and fill a large pot half full with water. Add 1 teaspoon of salt and bring to a boil. Add peppers, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain peppers and set aside.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Cook one cup of basmati rice according to package directions.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Add olive oil to a large skillet, then heat to medium-high and brown the ground beef. Add diced vegetables and cook the mixture until the vegetables are tender but not overcooked. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, crushed garlic, oregano, basil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Add rice and cooked ground beef mixture in a large bowl, then stir to combine. Add half of the shredded cheddar cheese and stir to blend. Stuff peppers with meat mixture and place in a 3-quart baking dish. Top each pepper with remaining cheese.
8e2506c4-70fa-425c-8e87-3f5de47169d7 Bake at 350 F for about 30 minutes or until cheese just begins to bubble and brown.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Gather the ingredients.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Mix the rice, sugar, and salt in a large saucepan.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Stir in the milk and add the piece of vanilla bean or the vanilla extract.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Place the mixture over medium heat and bring to a boil, stirring often.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the rice is soft and the mixture becomes thick. Stir often.
04518199-d7d2-41f8-aca5-7dfcab249c9d Serve warm with cinnamon and sugar or fruit compote or both. Enjoy!
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Gather the ingredients.
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Cover rice with water and soak at least 1 hour or up to 4 hours.
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Grease 6 to 8 ramekins OR an 8-inch square cake pan with a little vegetable oil (if you happen to have coconut oil, use that).
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Drain rice and distribute among ramekins or in cake pan. Rice should be at least 1/2 to 3/4 inch deep in each ramekin. Preheat oven to 350 F.
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Place coconut milk, brown sugar, vanilla and salt in a mixing bowl. Crack in the eggs and stir everything together until sugar dissolves. Taste for sweetness, adding more sugar if desired. Pour over rice in the pan/ramekins (if using ramekins, distribute it as evenly as you can), stirring to combine.
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c Bake 35 to 40 minutes (an inserted fork should come out clean or nearly clean). If you're adding the topping, the cake(s) can remain a little undercooked at this stage, as they will be going back in the oven. While baking, prepare topping (if using).
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c For the topping (optional): Place topping ingredients in a pot or saucepan. Stir with a whisk over medium heat until mixture begins to lightly bubble. Reduce heat to low, whisking continuously for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and continue whisking until it thickens and most of the lumps are gone. Transfer to a bowl to cool.
d7983e67-8d5a-4ac4-b0c7-bf7e391dc93c When rice layer is done baking, spread on the topping. Take another baking dish and fill at least 1 inch deep with hot water from the tap. Place this on a lower rack and set cake(s) on a higher rack. Bake 15 minutes, until topping feels firm when lightly touched. Serve either warm or at room temperature. This cake is best stored outside the refrigerator and eaten within 3 days.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Gather the ingredients.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Brown sausage in a skillet or sauté pan until no longer pink, breaking up with a fork.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Add minced onion and cook 2 to 3 minutes longer.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Pour off most of the excess fat.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Stir in broth and rice. Cover and simmer gently 18 to 20 minutes or until rice is tender and most of the broth is absorbed.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Add the minced fresh parsley and toss to combine.
eea3b88b-2579-4dc8-af36-955fb95313aa Serve and enjoy!
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Add the sofrito and lightly fry for about 1 minute.
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Add the sazón, salt, beans, and rice. Stir to combine the ingredients and coat the rice with color.
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Pour in the water (or chicken broth) and bring to a rolling boil. Allow to boil for 1 to 2 minutes and then stir the rice mixture.
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Reduce the heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid that will not allow steam to escape. Do not lift the lid during the cooking time.
52dd5735-fb14-4627-8917-d2efe3f1899e Cook on low for 30 minutes. Remove the lid, fluff the rice with a fork, and put the lid back on. Let sit a few minutes before serving as a side dish.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed Gather the ingredients.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed If you don't have steamed rice on hand, prepare 4 servings of cooked rice per your rice cooker instruction. To prepare cooked rice on the stove, follow these instructions.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed Make the sushi rice. Using warm rice, gently mix in the Sushinoko brand powdered sushi vinegar mix using the edge of a rice paddle with diagonal slashing motions. Note, a 2.6-ounce package of Sushinoko powdered sushi vinegar may be used to season 4 cooked servings of rice (about 1 cup cooked rice per serving).
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed In a small pot, heat water over medium high heat and hard boil egg. It will take about 8 to 10 minutes for the egg to cook. Remove the egg from the water and let it cool. Peel the shell, save the egg white to enjoy later, and crumble the egg yolk into small bits with a fork.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed While the egg is cooking, prepare the balsamic soy sauce. In a small pot heat balsamic vinegar and soy sauce over medium heat until warmed. Add a dash of black pepper and set aside to cool.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed Chop mitsuba herb (or watercress or cilantro). Chop ginger into thin matchstick pieces and chop the matchstick pieces into tiny cubes. Set aside.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed In a medium frying pan, heat olive oil over medium-high heat and cook the steak until medium. Cook about 6 to 7 minutes on the first side, and flip the steak over and cook for another 4 to 5 minutes. Let the steak rest for about 3 to 5 minutes before slicing and chopping up the steak. By allowing the steak to rest you let the juices circulate back into the meat for tender, juicy meat.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed If you prefer, drizzle some of the balsamic soy sauce over the chopped steak to allow the flavor to absorb into the meat. Otherwise, the balsamic soy sauce can be drizzled over the chirashi sushi before serving.
718fc740-3fb4-4e7d-a497-5ca1c9dc04ed Assemble the chirashi sushi. On individual plates, place a serving of sushi rice on the plate and spread out. Top the sushi rice with cubed beef. Garnish with chopped mitsuba and ginger. Garnish with crumbled egg yolk. Drizzle balsamic soy sauce over the beef and chirashi sushi. Enjoy immediately!
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Heat the oven to 350 F.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Butter a large baking dish (about 2 1/2 to 3 quarts in size).
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Prepare the vegetables. Peel the onion and chop it finely. Chop the celery. Remove the stem and seeds from the bell pepper and chop it finely.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e In a large heavy skillet over medium heat, fry the bacon until crisp; remove the bacon to paper towels to drain. Crumble bacon and set aside.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e In the same skillet with the bacon drippings, saute the chopped onion, celery, and bell pepper until just softened.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e To the skillet, add the rice, the pureed tomatoes, the drained crumbled bacon, half of the salt, pepper, sugar, and hot sauce.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Bring the rice and vegetables to a boil; reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes. Taste and add more salt, if needed.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Transfer the rice mixture to the prepared baking dish.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Cover the baking dish tightly with foil and bake the rice in the preheated oven for about 40 to 50 minutes or until the rice is tender. Check the rice after about 30 minutes and add water or stock, if necessary, to keep the rice moist.
a13eb709-35b8-4f31-bb8a-89d24f39661e Fluff with a fork before serving.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Trim the stem end off the onion. Leave the root end in tact to hold the layers of the onion together. Cut the onion in half lengthwise and remove the peel. Working with one-half of the onion at a time, make horizontal cuts into the onion before making vertical and then crosswise cuts to finely chop the onion, using the root end as a sort of a handle. Set the onion aside.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Peel and mince the garlic. Set aside.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Pick over and trim the spinach. Rinse it clean, spin or pat it dry. You really want the spinach dried off to avoid having to cook off the water later. Cut the leaves into thin ribbons. Set aside.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 In a medium pot over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft, about 3 minutes.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Add the garlic to the onion and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the spinach. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the leaves are wilted and any liquid that has cooked out of the spinach has evaporated, about 4 minutes. If there's a lot of liquid, turn up the heat and boil it off.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Add the rice and stir to coat it and make sure it's as well-combined with the spinach and onions as possible. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the dill, if you like. Cover and reduce the heat to low. Cook, undisturbed, for 15 minutes. Without removing the cover, remove the pot from the heat and let sit 5 minutes.
18ade4d0-949e-41a8-9dde-163de854b075 Remove the cover. Fluff the pilaf with a fork. Stir in the pepper, if you like. Serve the pilaf hot or warm.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Rinse the beans and rice and soak in filtered water for a few hours or overnight. Drain well.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Blend the ginger root and coconut together with 1 cup of water and set aside.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Heat the olive oil over medium flame in a heavy-bottomed pot. Grind up the cumin, coriander, and fennel and add to the pot along with the cardamom and turmeric. Stir briefly, and then add the ginger-coconut mixture, bay leaves and cinnamon.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Stir well, add the beans and grains and salt to taste, along with 6 cups filtered water.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and cook 30 to 35 minutes, until the dal and rice are tender.
186af8ef-7e38-42c1-a28f-a03839950cae Add the chopped cilantro, stir well and serve.
fba5915b-f6b4-4cfe-abdd-5bec9a1dc73d Grease a 2-quart baking dish. Heat the oven to 375 F.
fba5915b-f6b4-4cfe-abdd-5bec9a1dc73d Put the uncooked rice in the baking dish. Combine the condensed soup, water, and onion soup mix; pour over the rice and stir to blend ingredients.
fba5915b-f6b4-4cfe-abdd-5bec9a1dc73d Place the chicken in the rice mixture and sprinkle lightly with pepper.
fba5915b-f6b4-4cfe-abdd-5bec9a1dc73d Cover tightly with foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until rice is tender and chicken is cooked through.
fba5915b-f6b4-4cfe-abdd-5bec9a1dc73d Remove the foil and top with the toasted almonds, if desired. To toast almonds for garnish, spread them out in a dry skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly. When they start to brown and smell toasty, remove them to a plate to cool.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Gather the ingredients.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Season pork chops on both sides with the poultry seasoning, salt, and pepper.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, brown the pork chops well, about 5 minutes per side. A good sear helps to keep the moisture inside and the chops tender and juicy; don't cover the pan when searing as it will make the chops sweat and soggy.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Remove from the pan and reserve on a plate.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Pour off the excess oil and place the pan back on the stove over medium heat. Add the butter and the onion, along with a big pinch of salt.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Sauté for about 10 minutes, or until the onions are well browned. The onions need to caramelize for the best results.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Add the chicken broth, buttermilk, and water. As the mixture comes to a simmer, use a wooden spoon to scrape any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Turn the heat to low and let the onion gravy gently simmer for 15 minutes. Add a splash of water if it seems to be getting too thick.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Add the pork chops and any juices back into the pan and coat with the gravy. Cook for about 10 to 15 minutes, or until the pork is done. Remember that the internal temperature must reach at least 145 F for a safe level of doneness. Taste for seasoning and adjust if needed.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Serve pork chops over white rice and topped with the onion gravy.
3ca0568d-dae9-4908-baef-dd988d37bbe1 Enjoy.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c In a heavy oven-proof saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic; sauté and stir for 4 to 5 minutes until translucent.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Add the rice; cook and stir for 4 to 5 minutes longer.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Add the broth, basil, salt, and pepper and bring to a simmer, stirring frequently.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Cover the pan with foil, then add the lid. Place in the oven.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Bake for 20 minutes, then carefully remove from the oven, remove the lid and foil, and stir thoroughly.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Return the foil and lid and place back in the oven.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c Bake 5 minutes longer. Test the rice to see if it's done; it should have a slight firmness in the center. If the rice isn't done, cover and return to the oven and bake 5 to 10 minutes longer.
6375f7d3-a25e-4c5b-a6c8-30b6cabf314c When the rice is done, stir in the cheese and butter. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Gather the ingredients.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 With the tip of a sharp knife, make a shallow cut down the back of each shrimp. Peel the shrimp, remove the dark veins.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Rinse the shrimp under cold running water.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Bring a small saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the shrimp and cook for about 2 minutes, or until they are pink and opaque.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Drain and transfer the shrimp to a bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 To make the roux, wipe the saucepan out with a paper towel and add the flour and oil, mixing well. Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking for 8 to 12 minutes, or until the mixture turns a light reddish-brown. Stir constantly to prevent scorching.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Transfer the roux to the crock pot.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Add all but the shrimp to the crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Add the cooked shrimp to the gumbo and mix well. Cover and continue to cook on low for 15 to 20 minutes.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Meanwhile, cook the rice in the chicken stock or water, following the package directions.
832845bc-1974-406e-bbe1-cc56c4952d82 Serve the gumbo over the hot cooked rice along with crusty French baguettes, cornbread, or biscuits.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Heat a large cast-iron pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 When the pot has heated, add the oil.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 When the oil is hot, add the flour and cook, whisking almost constantly (that is, about every 15 seconds), for 10 minutes.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook, stirring almost constantly, for 5 to 10 minutes longer until roux is medium color the color of peanut butter.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Add the bell pepper, onion, and celery and cook, stirring often, for another 10 minutes. Add the salt, the three types of pepper and bay leaves and stir to combine seasonings with the roux.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Add the stock and water. Raise heat and bring to a boil, whisking constantly.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Reduce heat to medium, add the Andouille slices, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Add the shrimp and simmer 5 minutes longer.
0de5f5c1-ca1f-4475-a804-54f2a8e7e4f0 Serve a scoop of rice on top of each bowl of gumbo, then sprinkle with the green onions and parsley. (Cook the rice while the gumbo is simmering for the final 30 minutes.)
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Gather the ingredients.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 In a large saucepan, combine the ground beef with the onion and 2 cloves of the garlic; cook and stir to break up the meat until the beef is browned and the onion and garlic are tender; drain well and set aside.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 In a large bowl, mix together the beef mixture, the cooked rice, mustard, egg, and salt and pepper until combined.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Cut out the core end of the cabbage and remove and discard some of the exterior leaves. Then carefully remove 8 whole perfect leaves. Soak the leaves in hot water in a large bowl until they are limp and pliable.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Chop half of the remaining cabbage and add this to the beef and rice mixture. Roll up about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture in each cabbage leaf. Reserve any remaining meat mixture. At this point, preheat the oven to 350 F.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Then, in the same large skillet, saute two cloves of garlic in the olive oil until tender, about 2 to 3 minutes.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Add the tomato puree, diced tomatoes, bay leaves, salt, and pepper. Simmer this sauce for 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Then remove and discard the bay leaves.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Place the stuffed cabbage rolls in a Dutch oven or large casserole. Top the rolls with any remaining meat mixture. Pour the tomato sauce mixture over all.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Cover the casserole and bake for 80 to 90 minutes or until the cabbage rolls are tender.
f66ca8b0-c8b9-4e78-b7c1-6c11109b90e1 Serve the stuffed cabbage with the sauce. Enjoy!
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 350 F.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Heat a heavy-bottomed, oven-proof saucepan over medium heat, then add the butter.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 In a separate small saucepan, bring the stock or broth to a boil. It's a good idea to check the seasoning of the cooking liquid and make any necessary adjustments with the salt before it gets too hot to taste.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 When the butter gets foamy, add the diced onion and celery, and sauté until the onion is slightly translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Add the uncooked rice and sauté, stirring constantly, for about a minute, or until the rice is fully coated with the melted butter.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Add the hot stock or broth, bring the pot back to a boil, cover, and place the entire pot in the oven.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Cook the rice pilaf in the oven for 18 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. If after 18 minutes, there's still liquid in the pot or the rice is still too moist, re-cover, and return the pot to the oven for another 2 to 4 minutes.
17ad8506-1add-4f55-b19c-f97ca75e3f64 Remove the pot from the oven, and gently fluff the rice pilaf with a wooden fork. Then place a paper towel across the top of the pot, replace the lid, and let the rice pilaf stand for 10 minutes.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Gather the ingredients.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Toast the rice over medium heat in a dry skillet until lightly golden. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a plate or platter to cool.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Place the remaining spices, except the turmeric, into the skillet and cook over medium heat until fragrant and toasty. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a plate or platter to cool.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Place the cooled rice and spices into a spice mill, blender, or food processor. Grind into a fine powder. Place the powder in a bowl and thoroughly stir in the turmeric.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Store the seasoning in an airtight jar, container, or sealed baggie. Be sure to label it and record the date you made it. The powder will keep for several months.
750e6cf4-8d5c-4132-8cfa-6f251fc6f42d Enjoy!
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c Gather the ingredients.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c Khichdi can be cooked in standard cooking pot but is prepared fastest in a pressure cooker. Heat the cooking oil in the pot/ pressure cooker on medium heat.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c When hot, add the cumin seeds and dry red chilli to it. Fry till the sizzling stops, then add the ginger and garlic pastes. Fry for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c Add the chopped tomatoes and fry till soft and pulpy.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c Add the spinach and stir. Now add the rice, Toor daal, salt to taste and the 3 cups of water. Stir well.
