ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c Allow the water to come to a boil and then put on the cover of the pressure cooker. Cook till you have heard 3 whistles/ pressure releases. Turn off the heat and release the pressure from the cooker. Open the cover. The Khichdi should be cooked now.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c If you are using a standard pot, cook on medium heat. When the water comes to a boil, reduce the heat a little and cover. Check occasionally and stir to prevent burning at the bottom and to ensure even cooking. Cook till the rice and daal are soft and most of the water has dried up. Add more, as required, to maintain the required consistency.
ea42330c-6a3e-4c95-96cf-7963755be17c When cooked, serve with yogurt and your favorite chutney or pickle!
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Gather the ingredients.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Combine soup and water in the slow cooker. Stir to blend well.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Stir in the uncooked rice, celery, diced turkey, poultry seasoning, and dried onion.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Cover and cook on high for about 2 1/2 to 3 hours or on low for about 5 hours.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd About 20 to 30 minutes before the dish is done and the rice is just tenderit will be mushy if cooked too longthaw the vegetables in a colander under cold running water.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Add the vegetables to the rice and turkey mixture.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd If desired, top with some shredded cheese and continue cooking for 20 to 30 minutes.
95aa51aa-e5c2-444a-b20a-1ecdba4abfcd Serve and enjoy!
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Gather the ingredients.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Combine the salt, seasoned salt, chili powder, and pepper in a small bowl. Trim the pork chops and discard any excess fat.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; sear the pork chops for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, seasoning both sides with 1 teaspoon of the seasoning mixture as they cook.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Drain off any excess fat, leaving the pork chops in the skillet. Add the rice to the skillet along with the tomatoes, green bell pepper, onion, olives, and sugar. Arrange sliced zucchini around the edge of the skillet and sprinkle with remaining seasoning mixture.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through (at least 145 F/63 C) and the rice is tender. If you are using brown rice, allow extra time.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Top with the mozzarella cheese and cover the pan. Cook for about 2 minutes longer, or until the cheese has melted.
6db31f84-ec6b-4dfd-be01-332b939a4552 Serve and enjoy!
500ff898-02f0-4981-95fb-e890c23bac4e Preheat the oven to 350 F.
500ff898-02f0-4981-95fb-e890c23bac4e In a heavy skillet over medium heat, cook the onion, bell pepper, and garlic in the olive oil until tender, stirring frequently.
500ff898-02f0-4981-95fb-e890c23bac4e Place this mixture in large bowl along with the uncooked rice, salt, pepper, egg, basil pesto, and milk, and mix well using a spoon.
500ff898-02f0-4981-95fb-e890c23bac4e Add the ground beef and cheese to the ingredients in the bowl and mix gently with your hands until combined. Form the beef mixture into a loaf shape and place on a broiler pan with slits for the fat to drain off.
500ff898-02f0-4981-95fb-e890c23bac4e Bake the meatloaf at 350 F for 55 to 65 minutes or until the internal temperature registers 160 F as measured with a reliable meat thermometer. Cover the meatloaf with foil and let the loaf stand for 10 minutes before slicing to serve.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Gather the ingredients.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Fill a large saucepan with 2 1/2 cups of water or unsalted chicken or vegetable broth.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Add the rice and place the pan over high heat. Bring the rice to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for about 45 minutes, or until the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is tender. (If the liquid has been absorbed and the rice isn't quite tender yet, add more water.) Let the rice stand for 5 minutes and then fluff with a fork. Set aside.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 In a skillet over medium-low heat, melt the butter.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Add the chopped onion and green bell pepper and cook, stirring for 4 to 6 minutes, or until the onion is softened and lightly browned.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Add the canned or fresh cooked mushrooms (see below), rice, seasoned salt, and about 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper to the onions and peppers. Cook for 2 to 4 minutes, or until the rice is hot, stirring and turning frequently.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Taste and adjust the seasonings.
b021a792-34a8-4f07-adaf-c41c588b5187 Serve and enjoy!
3d781b01-8a30-4416-aadf-b693c57243d4 Cook the rice as directed on package; fluff it and keep warm in the rice cooker or cover and keep warm in a 170 F to 200 F oven or warming drawer, or transfer the rice to a slow cooker with a warm setting.
3d781b01-8a30-4416-aadf-b693c57243d4 Cut the chicken breasts into 3/4-inch pieces. Remove the seeds from the chile peppers and mince.
3d781b01-8a30-4416-aadf-b693c57243d4 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the diced chicken, jalapeño peppers, bell peppers, kosher salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, stirring constantly. Add the shrimp and continue cooking for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the shrimp are opaque and pink, stirring constantly.
3d781b01-8a30-4416-aadf-b693c57243d4 Add the fresh chopped tomatoes or canned tomatoes and the tomato paste, if using. Cook for about 1 minute longer, or until hot and bubbling, stirring occasionally.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Sprinkle the ground beef, chopped chicken livers, and gizzards with salt and pepper.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f In a large skillet or sauté pan over medium-high heat, brown the meats in the vegetable oil or shortening.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Cook, stirring constantly until the meat is browned and no longer pink.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Add chopped celery, onion, bell pepper, and garlic to the meat.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Cook, stirring, until the onions are translucent.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Add a small amount of water.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Cover and simmer on low heat until vegetables are tender.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Add cooked rice and stir gently to combine.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper, to taste.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f Cover and let stand until ready to serve.
53167607-f056-4c7e-b585-e31478fe2c3f If desired, garnish with green onions or parsley and fluff with a fork just before serving.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Rinse the rice well in a colander.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Bring the water to boil in a saucepan. Add the rice and the salt.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Allow the rice to boil for about 1 minute. Stir at least once to prevent sticking, but don't overdo it.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Cover the saucepan with an appropriate tight-fitting lid that does not have an exhaust hole.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Reduce the heat to low and allow the rice to simmer for about 30 minutes.
a1cead22-56da-43a0-ad9d-14925a94d579 Fluff the rice with a fork and serve.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Heat oil in a large skillet and add rice and garlic. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes until rice is coated with oil and starts to turn a bit golden in spots.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Add wine, pepper, and 1 cup chicken broth to the skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook mixture for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently, until liquid is absorbed.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Add about 1/2 cup of the remaining broth, stirring the rice until liquid is absorbed.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Continue until the rice is tender, and the risotto is the consistency you want.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Add lemon juice, spinach, lemon peel, and tuna. Cook and stir gently until spinach is wilted.
ce52b636-5b52-47f9-9173-7129e88602ed Stir in butter until melted along with 1/2 cup cheese. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and serve.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Gather the ingredients.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Preheat the oven to 375 F.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d To drain the tofu: Wrap the tofu in a clean dish towel and place a plate on top. Place a heavy can or similar item on top of the plate to weigh it down, and let drain for 20 minutes.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Add 2 cubes of vegetable bouillon to the 5 cups of water.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Cook rice according to package directions, using the vegetable bouillon.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-low heat, then add the vegetables.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Cover and cook until carrots are soft, salt to taste, then set aside until ready to use.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Slice the tofu about 1/2 inch thick. Mix olive oil and sage together and brush onto tofu slices, then transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Roast the tofu for about 30 minutes or until firm and browned on both sides. Remove from the oven, let cool, then cut into bite-sized pieces.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Make the sauce by combining all sauce ingredients into a food processor. Blend until very smooth. Set aside.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Once the rice is finished cooking, combine everything together with the rice in the pot. Warm on low heat if needed. Serve hot.
bc1644d8-9a88-4bda-abd7-d2d7c6761a6d Enjoy!
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Gather the ingredients.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 First, press your tofu.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Once your tofu is well-pressed, cut it into your desired shapes. Thin slabs, triangles or even small bite-sized shapes will work.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Once your tofu is ready to go, pre-heat the oven to 400 F. I highly recommend lining a baking tray with aluminum foil if you can, since baked tofu sometimes gets a bit sticky, and the foil makes clean up super easy.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Next, prepare the sauce. Whisk together the peanut butter (I like to melt it slightly in the microwave for just a few seconds to make this easier) with the ginger, lime juice or orange juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, maple syrup and sweet chili sauce. Before you bake your tofu, give the sauce a quick taste. It should be delicious! If not, adjust the seasonings to taste.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Coat the tofu with the peanut sauce on all sides. You can transfer the sauce to a wide shallow bowl or dish and dip it in, or use a pastry brush to coat each piece by hand if you're working with larger pieces of tofu. I like to dip it, then brush on extra sauce.
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Bake the tofu in the oven for about 15 to 17 minutes, keeping an eye on them so they don't burn. Turn pieces over, and bake another 10 to 15 minutes. (Note: The sauce on the aluminum foil will burn a bit, don't worry. You just don't want to see the coated tofu burn.)
74b67f9b-df37-458e-85cd-42a1f22b9ad1 Serve and enjoy!
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Gather the ingredients.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Wrap the tofu with paper towels, and place it on a flat tray. Put a cutting board or a flat plate on top of the tofu, and let sit for about 15 minutes.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Meanwhile, put dashi, soy sauce, and mirin in a saucepan, and bring to a boil.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Mix 1 tablespoon katakuriko potato starch with 1 tablespoon water.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Add the katakuriko mixture to the sauce, and stir quickly. Stop the heat.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Dry the tofu with paper towels, and cut each tofu piece in half.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Dust the tofu with 4 tablespoons of katakuriko to coat the pieces completely.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Heat oil to 350 F in a deep pot.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Deep-fry the tofu pieces until they turn light brown. Drain on paper towels.
62a0de3d-af35-4364-8af1-1f9cd903221d Place each fried tofu piece in a small dish and pour the sauce over it. Garnish with grated ginger and bonito flakes, if using.
8687e11f-fba9-4440-89df-c9aecf2444a6 Warm flour tortillas over stove or in microwave until heated and soft.
8687e11f-fba9-4440-89df-c9aecf2444a6 In a large skillet or frying pan, sautee the garlic and onion in the vegetable oil for a minute or two, then add the diced tofu, mushrooms and tomatoes and cook, stirring frequently, for about 4-6 minutes, or until the mushrooms are soft and cooked.
8687e11f-fba9-4440-89df-c9aecf2444a6 Remove the pan from heat. Mix in the turmeric and a few dashes of Tabasco sauce, then season generously with salt and pepper, to taste.
8687e11f-fba9-4440-89df-c9aecf2444a6 Place a couple of spoonfuls of the tofu and vegetable mixture in each flour tortilla. Top with vegan sour cream and vegan cheese if desired, then wrap up your burritos and serve hot. You may find that you have enough tofu and veggies to make more than four burritos worth, depending on how full you make them.
8687e11f-fba9-4440-89df-c9aecf2444a6 To wrap your burritos, place a layer of filling in a horizontal row just below the center of the tortilla, leaving about 2 inches on the ends. Then, fold those ends (the right and left sides) in, and then roll the burrito up away from you.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Gather the ingredients.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Working in batches as needed, process the tofu in a blender or food processor until smooth and creamy.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Add the tofu to a large mixing bowl, and stir in the sage, thyme, rosemary, vegetable broth powder, and poultry seasoning, stirring well to combine.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Line a colander with cheesecloth or a thin towel.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Place the tofu in the colander and a layer of cheesecloth or a thin towel on top. Place a weight on top of the towel to gently press the tofu.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Place on a plate or towel and chill for at least 3 hours.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Once the tofu is chilled and firm, scoop out the tofu in the middle, creating a hole or a well, and leaving about 1 1/2 inches of a tofu "shell" in the colander.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Gently pat your stuffing into the "well," then gently press the extra tofu on top.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Carefully invert your tofu turkey onto a lightly greased baking sheet.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Whisk together the balsamic vinegar, red wine, Dijon mustard, and soy sauce.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Generously baste or brush the mixture on tofu.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Bake for about 90 minutes at 350 F, basting again every 15 minutes.
59c76ad8-cc88-458e-a6de-5fd4f5027162 Serve and enjoy!
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Place cubed tofu in a bowl and pour marinade over. Toss well to coat and set aside to marinate while you prepare your other ingredients.
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Combine all 'Stir-Fry Sauce' ingredients, stirring well to dissolve sugar. Taste-test the sauce, keeping in mind that the first taste should be spicy-salty, followed by sweet and finally the rich taste of the coconut milk. Adjust these flavors to suit your taste, adding more lime juice if too sweet or salty (note: it will be less salty when combined with the stir-fry).
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Warm a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons oil and swirl around, then add the marinated tofu. Stir-fry until lightly browned (2 to 3 minutes). If pan becomes dry, add a little stir-fry sauce, 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time. Remove fried tofu from pan and set aside.
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Add another 1 tablespoon oil then add the shallot/onion, garlic, ginger, and chili. Stir-fry 2 minutes, then add the carrot and mushrooms plus 3 to 4 tablespoons of the stir-fry sauce. Stir-fry 2 to 3 minutes.
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Add the broccoli and red pepper plus up to 1/2 of remaining stir-fry sauce, enough to gently simmer vegetables in the sauce. (Note: this is a 'saucy' stir-fry that is never dry - the sauce is meant to flavor the rice or noodles it is served with). Simmer until all the vegetables are cooked but still bright green with some crispness (2 to 3 minutes).
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Add the tofu back in. Add more of the stir-fry sauce as desired.
e6cd2e37-4bb2-4e02-966c-b04e364f20a3 Remove from heat and do one last taste-test. If not salty enough, add a little more fish or soy sauce. If too salty or sweet, add another squeeze of lime juice. Add more sugar or chili if desired. Top with fresh basil and serve over Thai jasmine-scented rice (also good with noodles!). Also delicious with our easy Thai coconut rice OR easy Thai sticky rice. ENJOY!
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 First, prepare your tofu. Like most tofu recipes, tofu scramble will taste best if you press the tofu first. This allows the tofu to absorb more of the flavorings and seasonings which you add to it. It's an extra step, but it just takes a few minutes.
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 Slice your pressed tofu into 1/2-inch thick strips.
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 Whisk together all ingredients except for tofu. Transfer to a shallow pan or zipped plastic bag then the tofu, coating well.
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 Allow tofu to marinate for at least one hour (the longer the better, turning to coat well with marinade).
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 Heat oven to 375 F.
433137a4-6632-43d8-9148-ebd25a421628 Transfer tofu and marinade to baking dish and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, turning halfway through and pouring extra marinade over the tofu as needed.
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Gather all the ingredients.
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Sauté the garlic and onion in olive or canola oil in a large skillet. Allow to cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the onion starts to get soft.
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Add the crumbled tofu and give it a quick stir.
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Add the curry powder, turmeric, cumin and salt and pepper to the skillet, stirring well to make sure the spices coat the tofu well.
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, then add the diced tomatoes, and allow to heat, stirring frequently for another 3 minutes or so, until tofu is hot and slightly crispy on the outside. (You may need to add a bit more oil if needed during the cooking process.)
98a25f3e-b703-4356-9a1a-5af0b7b3beaf Add the spinach, cover the pan and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, just until the spinach is wilted, stirring well.
d59db7dd-5250-4f85-addb-3620348adc76 Gather the ingredients.
d59db7dd-5250-4f85-addb-3620348adc76 Press the tofu by placing paper towels underneath and on top of the block and weighing it down for several minutes.
d59db7dd-5250-4f85-addb-3620348adc76 Slice the pressed tofu into 1/2-inch cubes.
d59db7dd-5250-4f85-addb-3620348adc76 In a small bowl, combine the tofu with the nutritional yeast, flour, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Toss gently to coat the tofu well. Or, place all ingredients in a zip-lock bag or covered container and shake well.
d59db7dd-5250-4f85-addb-3620348adc76 In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat until hot. Add the tofu. Cook for 4 to 6 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and lightly crispy on most sides.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Bring broth up to a boil.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Add garlic and ginger to the broth and reduce to simmer.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Add mushrooms and pepper and cook over low heat for 10 minutes.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Drain noodles and toss with sesame oil.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Coarsely chop green tops of green onions.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Add noodles and scallions to broth.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb Simmer for 3 minutes.
021a4c76-27f5-4362-af00-85a662040bcb To serve soup, divide between 4 serving bowls.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Gather the ingredients.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Prepare your tofu. Like most vegan tofu recipes, this one will taste best if you press the tofu.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Cut the tofu into 1-inch cubes.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Chop the broccoli, dice the onion, and mince the garlic.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded In a large skillet, saute onions and garlic in olive oil until the onions turn clear, about 3 to 5 minutes.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Add the tofu, ginger, cayenne, and broccoli to the pan and continue to cook until broccoli is done, another 6 to 8 minutes.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded In a separate small bowl, mix together the cornstarch, soy sauce, and water, then add this mixture to the broccoli and tofu.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Cook until sauce thickens, then remove from heat.
ef81a3ff-dbcd-4869-8858-bd1cfe954ded Serve the broccoli and tofu in garlic sauce over rice or whole grains and enjoy.
9a835b11-0d2d-4c61-b451-3ce68bf9711c Prepare the dairy-free pie dough according to the instructions, plate in a lightly oiled 9" tart or pie pan, cover with plastic wrap, and place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before filling with the quiche filling and baking.
9a835b11-0d2d-4c61-b451-3ce68bf9711c Preheat the oven to 350 F.
9a835b11-0d2d-4c61-b451-3ce68bf9711c Meanwhile, make the filling. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, adding the onions once hot. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onions are lightly caramelized, about 6-8 minutes. Add the remaining olive oil, garlic, vegan bacon, 1/2 teaspoon salt and red pepper flakes and cook until the garlic smells fragrant, about 4-5 minutes more. Remove from heat and transfer the mixture to a bowl. Set aside.
9a835b11-0d2d-4c61-b451-3ce68bf9711c In a steam basket set over boiling water, steam the broccoli for 3-5 minutes, or until bright green and lightly crisp. Toss with the onion-vegan bacon mixture and set aside.
9a835b11-0d2d-4c61-b451-3ce68bf9711c In the bowl of a food processor, process the tofu, lemon juice, tahini, rice vinegar, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt until smooth. Fold in the broccoli-onion mixture, stirring until evenly mixed. Using your hands, crumble the vegan cheese evenly into the bottom of the pie crust. Pour the filling on top of the vegan cheese in the prepared pie crust and bake for 45-55 minutes, or until golden brown and set. Serve hot.
7b873e50-47d8-403e-a071-8366d5d59cdb First, in a large soup or stockpot, saute the onion, garlic, sliced carrots, and shiitake mushrooms in oil for just a few minutes until lightly cooked; do not overcook.
7b873e50-47d8-403e-a071-8366d5d59cdb Reduce heat to low and add the vegetable broth, coconut milk, minced chili peppers, sliced ginger, lemongrass, tofu, and juice from one lime.
7b873e50-47d8-403e-a071-8366d5d59cdb Simmer over low heat for at least 15 minutes. Taste test and add salt as needed.
7b873e50-47d8-403e-a071-8366d5d59cdb Stir in the fresh chopped cilantro just before serving.
7b873e50-47d8-403e-a071-8366d5d59cdb Enjoy your vegetarian Thai coconut soup!
ab6cd450-691a-4bba-914c-9372e0828f63 Gather the ingredients.
ab6cd450-691a-4bba-914c-9372e0828f63 Press your tofu.
ab6cd450-691a-4bba-914c-9372e0828f63 Once your tofu is well-pressed, chop it into chunks, and combine your tofu with the remaining ingredients in a crock pot or slow cooker.
ab6cd450-691a-4bba-914c-9372e0828f63 Cover and cook on LOW for 5 to 6 hours.
ab6cd450-691a-4bba-914c-9372e0828f63 Serve and enjoy!
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Gather the ingredients.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Prepare the dairy-free graham cracker crust, baking the crust in a 9-inch pie plate. Allow the crust to cool completely.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac In a blender, combine the tofu, lime juice, zest (if using), sugar, salt, and cornstarch.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Process for several minutes, or until smooth and thick.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Pour into the prepared pie crust and place in the freezer for at least 2 hours, or until firm.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Serve from the freezer, garnished with lime wedges if desired.
e704552e-d56c-475e-8342-784dff8fdfac Enjoy!
f853e099-9021-4f77-b5e0-3b552a41561d Melt the chocolate chips over low heat, stirring frequently to ensure the chocolate doesn't burn.
f853e099-9021-4f77-b5e0-3b552a41561d You can use a double boiler if you have one.
f853e099-9021-4f77-b5e0-3b552a41561d Once the chocolate is melted, blend together the peanut butter, silken tofu, chocolate and soy milk in the blender until smooth and creamy, adding a bit more soy milk if necessary.
f853e099-9021-4f77-b5e0-3b552a41561d Pour into pie crust and refrigerate until firm, at least one hour.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 Once your tofu has been well-pressed, you can slice it into thin "finger" shapes, slabs, cubes, or whatever shape you like best.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 In a shallow pan or a zip-closing plastic bag, combine the cornstarch, garlic salt, mustard powder and black pepper. Carefully add the tofu, gently tossing to make sure that all sides of the tofu are well coated with the cornstarch mixture.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 Heat the oil in a sauté pan or skillet over medium heat, using a non-stick pan if you have it to reduce the amount of oil needed. Add tofu and pan-fry on all sides just until it is just lightly golden brown. Once the tofu has cooked, remove it from the pan and set it aside.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 Using the same pan (or a different one, your choice), heat the vegan margarine or butter substitute over very low heat. Once it is melted, add in the wing sauce, stirring just until combined well. Add the cooked tofu, gently turning to coat well on all sides with the wing sauce mixture.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 Once that is completely heated, you can take the tofu off of the stovetop heat and serve it while it is warm.
f8f7d3b7-e01c-4462-b974-091b10ca17f6 Serve with some vegan ranch dressing if you'd like.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Gather the ingredients.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Drain the tofu.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc While the tofu is draining, prepare the marinade. In a bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, light and dark soy sauce, Asian sesame oil, sugar, chili paste, garlic, and olive oil. Cover and refrigerate while preparing and dry frying the tofu.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Cut the drained tofu into triangles about 1/2 inch thick. Dry-fry the tofu.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Remove the marinade from the refrigerator and pour into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the dry-fried tofu. Refrigerate overnight, turning the bag occasionally so that all the tofu is covered.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Next day, prepare the vegetables for stir-frying. Remove the tofu from the bag. Reserve the marinade.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Preheat a wok on medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger slices and cook for a few seconds until fragrant. Add the onion and the mushrooms. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, adding water, vegetable broth, or Chinese rice wine or dry sherry if the vegetables begin to dry out.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Add the bell pepper. Stir briefly, then add the baby corn. Stir-fry for a minute, then add the tofu slices. Cook briefly, turning gently, to heat the tofu through.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Push the vegetables and tofu to the sides of the wok. Add the reserved marinade in the middle of the wok and bring to a boil. Re-stir the cornstarch/water mixture and add to the boiling liquid, stirring quickly to thicken.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Stir to combine the sauce with the other ingredients. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired.
4961effb-33d2-42b2-9d01-18c6a410cadc Serve and enjoy!
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Gather the ingredients.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 In a small bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, light and dark soy sauces, Asian sesame oil, sugar, chili paste, garlic, and olive oil.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Cover and refrigerate while preparing and dry frying the tofu if you haven't done so already.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Put the marinade in a large bowl or large resealable plastic bag. Add the dry-fried tofu pieces.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Cover the bowl or seal the bag and refrigerate overnight, stirring occasionally to make sure all the tofu pieces are covered.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Drain the tofu, reserving the tofu marinade to use as a sauce at the end of stir-frying. Thicken with a cornstarch slurry if desired.
937ba69c-c1e1-4bca-b49e-1911233b5fd3 Stir-fry and enjoy!
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Gather the ingredients.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e In a large mixing bowl, gently combine ground beef or ground pork, onion, cabbage, tofu, and noodles.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e In a separate small bowl, combine garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Pour seasoning mixture over meat and vegetables and mix with hands to combine.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Place about 1 tablespoon of filling in the center of dumpling wrapper.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Dip your finger in water and wet the perimeter of half of the wrapper.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Fold the wrapper in half, pressing to seal and then crimp the edges. Repeat until the filling is gone.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e You can steam, boil, fry, or sauté the dumplings as you wish.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Serve with basic dipping sauce or a spicy sauce.
2dd15359-6d02-480b-b3bb-2e50e597005e Enjoy!
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Gather the ingredients.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Drain the tofu well, pressing out the excess moisture gently. If you leave too much moisture in the tofu, you'll have trouble forming patties; they just won't stay together.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Once your tofu is well pressed and drained, gently mash into small crumbles in a large bowl.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Add the diced onions, diced green onions, wheat germ, flour, garlic powder, soy sauce, and a dash of pepper into the bowl along with the tofu. Mix to combine well.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Gently press the mixture together to form patties about 1-inch thick. You'll probably want to use your (clean!) hands for this.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Heat the oil on medium-high heat in a large skillet and fry the veggie burgers until lightly golden brown and crisp, about 5 to 6 minutes on each side.
00d7cc77-96f1-4d6e-b25c-b096eeeaf7be Serve and enjoy!
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Gather the ingredients.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Prepare the broth. In a large stockpot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring often, for about 2 minutes, or until fragrant. Add 1 1/2 cups of the chopped scallions and the vegetable broth. Bring the broth to a boil, then reduce the heat and allow the broth to simmer while you prepare the wontons.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Prepare the filling. In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the canola oil, adding the finely chopped mushrooms and garlic powder once hot. Cook, stirring often, until the mushrooms are soft, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the pan from heat and stir in the crumbled tofu, lemon juice, salt and remaining 1/2 cup chopped scallions.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Fill the wontons. Set out the wonton wrappers on a dry surface, such as a counter, cutting board, or baking sheet. Place about 1 T. of the filling into the center of the wontons. Moisten the edges of the wrappers with water, using a pastry brush or your fingers, and fold: pull one corner to it's diagonal and pinch, then pull the remaining two corners to the same point and pinch the edges closed. (To see this done step-by-step, check out my chocolate wontons recipe tutorial.) Repeat until all of the wontons or filling is used.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Bring a pot of salted water to simmering. Just before serving, cook the wontons you intend to serve with the meal (leftover wontons can be frozen until a later date) in the salted water until they become translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to remove the wontons from the boiling water. Transfer 3 to 4 wontons to each bowl.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Add the bok choy and broccoli florets to the simmering broth. Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the vegetables are bright green in color. Ladle the broth and greens over the wontons in the serving bowls and serve immediately with salt and pepper to taste.
166a6794-1d53-4b3b-a2b8-224085b2d083 Enjoy!
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Gather the ingredients.
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Prepare the tofu by pressing it to remove excess moisture.
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Once your tofu is well pressed, crumble or chop it into small bite-sized pieces.
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Add the oil to a large skillet over medium meat. Saute the crumbled or diced tofu with the bell pepper and scallions until the tofu is lightly browned.
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Add the tomatoes, garlic powder, onion powder, and turmeric, stirring to combine well. Cook, tossing, for another 6 to 8 minutes until hot and cooked.
30e141d1-5cb1-40e0-a455-3e2abcd4b508 Season generously with salt and pepper and top with the cheese (or vegan cheese) just before serving.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Gather the ingredients.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a In a large mixing bowl, gently combine egg, onion, cabbage, bean sprouts, tofu, and noodles.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a In a separate bowl, combine garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, salt and pepper.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Pour seasoning mixture over tofu and vegetables and use your hands to mix the ingredients together.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Place about 1 tablespoon of filling in the center of the dumpling wrapper.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Dip your finger in the water and wet the outside edge of the top half of the wrapper.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Fold the wrapper up to close it and then crimp the edges.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Repeat until the filling is gone.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Then steam, boil, fry, or sauté the dumplings as you wish.
24b98ceb-bbdc-4717-ac17-fa572b42a55a Enjoy!
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Cut the goya in half lengthwise.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Remove the seeds with a spoon.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Slice the goya thinly and place goya slices in a bowl.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Sprinkle some salt over them. Let them sit for about 10 minutes.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Wash goya slices and drain well.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Squeeze them to remove excess water.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Heat about 1 tbsp. of vegetable oil in a large skillet.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Stir-fry pork and season with salt and pepper.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Add goya slices and cook until softened.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Crumble tofu into large pieces and add in the skillet.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Lightly stir-fry with pork and goya. Season with sake.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Pour beaten eggs over and stir quickly. Season with soy sauce.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Stop the heat.
837facc1-4078-4f03-bc27-bc853f0a681e Adjust the flavor with salt.
7760ce1a-d911-4a7c-a5ad-dbe729d5c2ed Gather the ingredients.
7760ce1a-d911-4a7c-a5ad-dbe729d5c2ed In a large saucepan or stock pot, bring the dashi or stock to a simmer over medium-high heat but do not boil. Combine the white and red miso in a small dish, then add 1 1/2 cups of the hot dashi and whisk to combine. Set aside.
7760ce1a-d911-4a7c-a5ad-dbe729d5c2ed Simmer the dashi for 5 minutes more. Gently stir in the tofu and simmer for another 5 minutes. Again - do not boil! Add the baby bok choy, scallions, and miso mixture, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the bok choy is slightly wilted but still bright green.
7760ce1a-d911-4a7c-a5ad-dbe729d5c2ed Serve immediately while hot, taking care to stir before serving as the miso will settle.
7760ce1a-d911-4a7c-a5ad-dbe729d5c2ed Enjoy!
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf Gather the ingredients.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf First, prepare your tofu. Like most vegan tofu recipes, this one will taste best if you press the tofu first. Not sure how to do that? See this easy step-by-step guide on how to press tofu.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf After your tofu is well pressed, slice it into your desired shapes. Fingers, cubes, triangles or slabs will all work just fine, but the finger shape will give you the best coating-to-tofu ratio for this recipe.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf Once your tofu is ready to go, whisk together the egg replacer and water then add the Dijon mustard into it.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf In a separate bowl, combine the panko with a bit of salt and pepper and preheat a skillet with a bit of oil.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf Dip each piece of tofu into the mustard and egg replacer batter mixture, then coat well with panko. Fry your tofu in the oil, turning as needed, for a few minutes on each side.
9ed34a68-8b7b-4eda-8070-dab4d75916bf Enjoy your panko-coated tofu fingers! You'll probably want to serve them with a dipping sauce. Just about anything will do; a sweet chili sauce is a good option!
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Gather the ingredients.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Drain the tofu and cut into 1-inch cubes.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Soften the dried mushrooms by soaking in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Squeeze out any excess water and slice. If desired, strain and reserve a bit of the mushroom soaking water to add to the sauce.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Rinse the bamboo shoots under warm running water to remove any "tinny" taste. Drain thoroughly.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 In a small bowl or measuring cup, mix together the chicken broth, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Set aside.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 In another small bowl, dissolve the cornstarch in the water. Set aside.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Heat the wok and add 2 tablespoons oil, drizzling it around the sides of the wok. When the oil is hot, add the bean curd cubes. Stir-fry until browned. Remove the bean curd from the wok.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Add 2 tablespoons oil to the wok. When the oil is hot, add the garlic, and stir-fry until aromatic.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Add the dried mushrooms and bamboo shoots. Stir-fry for 1 minute.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Push the vegetables up to the sides. Re-stir the sauce and add in the middle of the wok.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Re-stir the cornstarch and water mixture and add to the sauce, stirring quickly to thicken.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Add the bean curd. Heat through.
d8049a06-1298-48b3-90d7-a3ef9d20b053 Remove from the stove and stir in a few drops of Asian sesame oil if desired. Serve hot.
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d First, drain and press your tofu. Most tofu will taste best if you press it first because tofu is like a spongethe more water you gently press out of it, the more delicious flavors it can soak up!
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d Once your tofu is well-pressed, preheat the oven to 325 F.
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d In a large frying pan, sauté the onions, garlic, and bottoms of the green onions in olive oil for 2 to 3 minutes. Add potatoes, salt, and pepper, and sauté for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally until potatoes are golden brown.
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d Blend tofu, soy sauce, and nutritional yeast in a food processor or blender until well-mixed. The mixture will be somewhat thick. Add green onions and potatoes and pour into a greased pie pan.
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d Bake 45 to 50 minutes until top is firm and cooked all the way through.
8c44b746-e421-442b-9696-a402b4da858d While your frittata is still hot, sprinkle the top with cheese if desired. Allow the frittata to cool slightly before slicing and serving, as this will help it set and firm up a bit more. Enjoy!
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf Mix the tofu, turmeric, onion powder and salt in a bowl and set aside.
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf In a medium skillet over medium heat, heat one tablespoon of the oil. Add the tofu mixture and cook, stirring constantly for 10 minutes. Remove the tofu from the heat and set aside.
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf Combine the soy sauce, sugar and green onions in a small bowl. Stir to dissolve the sugar and set aside.
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf Place a dry wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. When the wok begins to smoke, add the remaining oil, then the onions and rice.
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf Stir-fry for 3 minutes. Pour the soy sauce mixture and stir-fry until rice is heated through, about 5 minutes.
0a469a2b-8c0b-40a6-b6c2-65dea41a0bbf Stir in the cashews and the tofu and serve hot.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Gather the ingredients.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Preheat the oven to 375 F.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b To drain the tofu: Wrap the tofu in a clean dish towel and place a plate on top. Place a heavy can or similar item on top of the plate to weigh it down, and let drain for 20 minutes.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Add 2 cubes of vegetable bouillon to the 5 cups of water.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Cook rice according to package directions, using the vegetable bouillon.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-low heat, then add the vegetables.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Cover and cook until carrots are soft, salt to taste, then set aside until ready to use.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Slice the tofu about 1/2 inch thick. Mix olive oil and sage together and brush onto tofu slices, then transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Roast the tofu for about 30 minutes or until firm and browned on both sides. Remove from the oven, let cool, then cut into bite-sized pieces.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Make the sauce by combining all sauce ingredients into a food processor. Blend until very smooth. Set aside.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Once the rice is finished cooking, combine everything together with the rice in the pot. Warm on low heat if needed. Serve hot.
cc744949-8929-4bfc-ae2f-f62e0f4d733b Enjoy!
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Gather the ingredients.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 First, prepare your tofu. Like most vegan tofu recipes, this one will taste best if you press the tofu first. This allows the tofu to absorb more of the flavorings and seasonings you add to it. In this recipe, the tofu will need to absorb chili powder and cayenne pepper. Note: Not sure how to press tofu? It's simple, and it just takes a few minutes. See this easy step-by-step guide on pressing tofu.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Preheat the oven to 400 F and lightly brush a baking pan with olive oil.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Slice the tofu into rectangular strips, about 1/2 inch thick.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Combine the nutritional yeast, flour, cornmeal, and spices until well mixed.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Place the tofu in the cornmeal mixture a few pieces at a time and coat well. Place on a baking sheet.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Bake for 5 to 7 minutes or until lightly golden brown, then flip the tofu over and bake for another 5 minutes.
65927324-ed7e-4868-905a-cd1ae629c8c5 Enjoy!
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Gather the ingredients.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 In a bowl, soak Chinese dried mushrooms in hot water to cover for 20 to 30 minutes, until softened. Squeeze out excess water. Cut off the stems and discard. Cut the caps into thin slices.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Wipe the fresh mushrooms with a damp cloth, trim off any woody stems, and thinly slice.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Heat the oil in a preheated wok over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and chili paste. Stir for a few seconds, until aromatic.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Add all of the mushrooms and stir-fry for about 2 minutes; stir in the rice wine or dry sherry.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Add chicken broth, soy sauce, sugar, and pepper. Bring to a boil uncovered.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Add tofu and spinach leaves. Return to a boil and cook until spinach leaves turn bright green, 2 to 3 minutes.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Remove from the heat and stir in the sesame oil. Serve hot.
68010f3c-40a1-4fb3-99b4-e9e262fd9276 Enjoy!
bf26b40e-93e9-4fb2-a21a-b757414c9f71 Drain the tofu and cut into cubes. Marinate the ground pork in the soy sauce and cornstarch for 20 minutes.
bf26b40e-93e9-4fb2-a21a-b757414c9f71 Wash the green onions and cut on the diagonal into 1-inch pieces. Peel and finely chop the garlic.
bf26b40e-93e9-4fb2-a21a-b757414c9f71 Heat the wok over medium-high to high heat. Add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the chile paste and the chopped garlic. Stir-fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds). Add the ground pork. Stir-fry until the pork is nearly cooked through.
bf26b40e-93e9-4fb2-a21a-b757414c9f71 Lower the heat to medium, and add the black bean sauce and the tofu cubes. Cook over medium heat until the tofu is browned (8 to 10 minutes). Add water or chicken broth as needed. Stir in the green onion. Just before serving, sprinkle with the Szechuan peppercorn or ground coriander.
63218eeb-826b-47b8-bfb8-95b80a9a7a38 In a large skillet or wok, heat the oil and add garlic and ginger for just a minute or two, then add the tofu, carefully stirring to mix up the ginger and garlic. Heat for 3 to 4 minutes, until tofu is lightly golden.
63218eeb-826b-47b8-bfb8-95b80a9a7a38 Add the red bell pepper and celery and heat, stirring, for about a minute, then add the mushrooms and bamboo shoots.
63218eeb-826b-47b8-bfb8-95b80a9a7a38 Add the vegetable broth or water and soy sauce and allow to simmer for another minute or two, until vegetables are tender but not yet done.
63218eeb-826b-47b8-bfb8-95b80a9a7a38 Stir in water-cornstarch mixture, heat until thickened and vegetables are done cooking; then stir in cashews and green onions. Combine well.
63218eeb-826b-47b8-bfb8-95b80a9a7a38 Serve this vegetable stir fry immediately with steamed rice, cooked noodles, or your favorite whole grain.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a Gather the ingredients.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a Drain and mash the tofu. Wash and prepare all the vegetables. Lightly beat the egg with the salt and pepper. Combine the mashed tofu and vegetables with the egg and seasonings.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a Heat the oil for deep-frying while you are wrapping the wontons. The oil should be heated to between 360 and 375 F.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a To fill the wontons, lay a wrapper in front of you so that it forms a diamond shape. Wet all the edges of the wrapper with water. Place a teaspoon of filling in the middle. Bring the top half of the wrapper over the filling and seal the edges.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a Deep-fry the wontons until they are golden and crispy (about 2 minutes). Serve with hoisin sauce or soy sauce.
9bbfe512-4b73-49f0-a1d4-cbe5406dad9a Enjoy!
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Gather the ingredients.
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Prepare the tofu. Most tofu will taste best if you press it first. This is because tofu is like a spongethe more water you gently press out of it, the more delicious marinade it can soak up. To press tofu, place it on a layer of paper towels or a clean dish cloth, and place another layer of paper towels on top of the tofu. Place a weight on it, such as a heavy can inside a glass or ceramic bowl. Let it sit for 30 minutes to press.
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Slice the tofu into four thick slabs. Or, if you want to grill the tofu on skewers, chop it into cubes and place them on skewers.
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Whisk together remaining ingredients and add tofu, coating well. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least two hours, and up to overnight.
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat. Oil the grate lightly.
1b5d16fd-1f28-42dd-b9b4-89d034886770 Place tofu or bamboo skewers on the grill and cook until lightly browned on all sides (about five minutes), basting occasionally with extra marinade. Serve hot.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d Sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until soft, about 4 to 5 minutes.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d Add spinach and salt, stirring to combine well and cook just until spinach is heated through.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d Add crumbled tofu and mix well. Allow to cool completely.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the cashew or almond butter, soy milk, miso, soy sauce, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, and onion powder until smooth and creamy.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d Prepare the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, if needed, and preheat oven to 350 F.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d In a lightly greased lasagna pan, place a thin layer of the white cashew sauce and then a layer of noodles. Next, add spinach and more cashew white sauce, then a layer of noodles, continuing until all ingredients are used up. The top layer should be spinach and then sauce.
871dce45-2c49-41d0-a151-7e0b48a00e6d Bake for 40 minutes, or until done. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before serving, to allow lasagna to set.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 Pre-heat oven to 350 F.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 In a large pan, crumble the tofu and sauté in olive oil with taco seasoning or chili powder until lightly golden brown and coated with spices.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 Transfer the sautéed tofu to a large bowl and add approximately 1/2 cup enchilada sauce and half of the cheese. Combine well.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 In the bottom of a baking pan or casserole dish, spread a thin layer (about 1/4 cup) of enchilada sauce.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 Place a few spoonfuls of the tofu mixture in each flour tortilla. Roll up and place in baking dish, stacking each enchilada closely.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the tortillas in the pan and sprinkle the rest of the cheese on top.
11369c23-a0c0-4590-a16d-78a33c7c38e7 Bake your tofu enchiladas for 20 to 25 minutes, or until done.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together in a medium-sized bowl.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 In a separate large bowl, beat together the 2/3 cup sugar, vegan margarine, and lemon zest until smooth and fluffy. Add the tofu and lemon juice and whip until well mixed, then add the flour, baking soda, and salt.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 Add the flour mixture to the margarine mixture and stir until well combined.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 Form dough into one-inch balls and roll into the 1/4 cup sugar until well coated. Flatten slightly and bake for 8-10 minutes until lightly golden brown.
b082b9f3-98dc-4b3b-b79e-f583c14c8129 Serve and enjoy.
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Drain the tofu, cut into cubes and mash. Wash and prepare the vegetables. Combine the tofu with the remainder of the ingredients and seasonings.
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Lay out one of the gyoza wrappers in front of you. Dip your finger in the water and moisten the edges of the wrapper.
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Place a heaping teaspoon of filling in the middle of the wrapper.
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Fold the gyoza wrapper over the filling and pinch the edges to seal it shut. (You may want to use a cornstarch/water mixture to make this easier).
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet or wok.When oil is ready, carefully add the dumplings and cook on high heat until golden brown (about 1 minute). Without turning the dumplings over, add 1/2 cup of water and cover. Cook for about 1 minute to cook the raw filling and then uncover and continue cooking until most of the liquid is absorbed.
8302d48f-c0d6-43bf-9111-fb800776b83f Serve the potstickers with the burnt side on top, with potsticker dipping sauce or soy sauce mixed with minced ginger for dipping.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 In a soup pot or a large wok, stir-fry marinated bulgogi and onion(s) for a couple of minutes. Put ALL the marinade into the pot, do not discard any liquid.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 Add vegetables (except for mushrooms) and cover with water.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 Bring to a boil.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 Reduce to a low simmer.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 After 5 minutes, add mushrooms, tofu, and scallions.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 Turn off after 3 to 4 minutes.
74d5d314-16db-4247-a96a-2515d1f2c6c7 Season to taste with salt and soy sauce.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Gather the ingredients.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Add the garlic and heat for just a minute or two, until lightly browned.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Add the cubed tofu and cook until lightly golden brown on all sides, stirring occasionally as needed.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Once the tofu is almost cooked, add a splash of soy sauce or tamari, stirring to coat the tofu well.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Add the mushrooms and cook with the tofu for another minute.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Add the chopped Swiss chard. Drizzle with the sesame oil and stir.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Sprinkle with a bit of sea salt and a dash of cayenne pepper.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Allow the Swiss chard to cook down just a bit, until slightly wilted but still tender, rather than soft.
e1ac6688-0d60-4550-aec5-723475fbfe9b Serve immediately over brown rice and enjoy.
ee6f068d-e0df-488f-8976-e77605314f9c Preheat the oven to 350 F.
ee6f068d-e0df-488f-8976-e77605314f9c Prepare the manicotti according to package directions. Drain and rinse the noodles; gently pat dry.
ee6f068d-e0df-488f-8976-e77605314f9c In a large mixing bowl, stir together the mashed tofu, garlic, soy milk, olive oil, lemon juice, sugar, salt, pepper, parsley, and spinach, if using.
ee6f068d-e0df-488f-8976-e77605314f9c Spread a 9x13-inch baking pan with 2 cups of the spaghetti sauce. Gently spoon the tofu mixture into each manicotti until they are all full. Place the filled manicotti noodles in one layer on top of the spaghetti sauce.
ee6f068d-e0df-488f-8976-e77605314f9c Pour the remaining 2 cups spaghetti sauce over the stuffed noodles. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes, or until the sauce bubbles.
701df344-8e0e-4644-94a6-0d30dbfe6364 Combine the tofu, peanut butter, sugar, soy milk and vanilla in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth.
701df344-8e0e-4644-94a6-0d30dbfe6364 Spoon into the pie shell. Refrigerate at least 2 hours and serve.
1b2b2c65-a4f8-41e7-9041-166af87824dc Gather the ingredients.
1b2b2c65-a4f8-41e7-9041-166af87824dc In a small bowl, mash the tofu with a fork or crumble with your hands.
1b2b2c65-a4f8-41e7-9041-166af87824dc Mix in the remaining ingredients until well combined.
8f577469-e437-46c4-84e7-6cfd9d2d6cd0 If using beef, then saute beef until slightly browned in a soup pot. If using shrimp, then skip this step and combine shrimp with vegetables.
8f577469-e437-46c4-84e7-6cfd9d2d6cd0 Add stock, onion, garlic, zucchini, potato, and pepper and bring to a boil over high heat.
8f577469-e437-46c4-84e7-6cfd9d2d6cd0 Add soybean paste, chili pepper paste, pepper flakes (if using), and tofu.
8f577469-e437-46c4-84e7-6cfd9d2d6cd0 When the stew begins boiling again, turn off heat and add chopped scallions.
9e755f9a-637e-4ada-9a33-d46015cb13e8 Grill the asparagus. Heat the grill to high heat. Brush the asparagus spears with olive oil. Lightly salt and pepper, and grill for about 5 minutes, or until just lightly browned and still crisp. Remove from the grill, cut into pieces and set aside.
9e755f9a-637e-4ada-9a33-d46015cb13e8 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Lightly oil a 9" pie plate and set aside.
9e755f9a-637e-4ada-9a33-d46015cb13e8 Prepare the quiche. Sprinkle about 1/2 of the crumbled dairy-free cheese in the bottom of the pie plate. Spread the asparagus on top of the crumbled dairy-free cheese. Set aside. In a blender, process the tofu, soy milk, nutritional yeast, ground cashews, cornstarch, dairy-free cream cheese, salt, freshly ground pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and turmeric until smooth. Stir in the remaining crumble dairy-free cheese using a wooden spoon. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie plate.
9e755f9a-637e-4ada-9a33-d46015cb13e8 Bake for 35 to 40 minutes until golden brown, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges clean. Serve warm or cold.
ff6cd89f-3f6e-4751-9998-ad2e031a4eba Gather the ingredients.
ff6cd89f-3f6e-4751-9998-ad2e031a4eba In a blender or food processor, pulse together all ingredients except pecans until apples are minced and ingredients are blended. Alternatively, you can finely chop the apples by hand and mix together the ingredients.
ff6cd89f-3f6e-4751-9998-ad2e031a4eba Gently fold in the pecans.
ff6cd89f-3f6e-4751-9998-ad2e031a4eba Drop by large spoonfuls onto a lightly oiled skillet or griddle and cook for a few minutes, until bubbles appear. Flip and cook until both sides are lightly golden brown.
ff6cd89f-3f6e-4751-9998-ad2e031a4eba Serve and enjoy!
5fffb4d4-ef21-4792-afef-332310f619e4 Make sure your tofu is well pressed before beginning. Not sure what that means or how to do that? See this simple step-by-step guide for how to press tofu.
5fffb4d4-ef21-4792-afef-332310f619e4 In a small bowl, whisk together all the ingredients except for the tofu until smooth and creamy.
5fffb4d4-ef21-4792-afef-332310f619e4 Add the tofu, and coat well with the sauce. Allow marinating in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
5fffb4d4-ef21-4792-afef-332310f619e4 Heat a bit of oil in a saute or frying pan. Add tofu, coating with any extra sauce, to make sure all the sauce is used, and fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until golden.
5fffb4d4-ef21-4792-afef-332310f619e4 Use your tofu paneer "cheese" as a substitute in any Indian recipe that calls for paneer.
0739210c-b8be-4e57-b736-ad930c5febb7 Put the mushrooms in a small bowl or measuring cup and pour 1/2 cup boiling water over them. Let soak 15 minutes. Lift mushrooms out of the water, rubbing them clean of any grit as you do. Roughly chop the mushrooms and set aside. Reserve the soaking liquid.
0739210c-b8be-4e57-b736-ad930c5febb7 Meanwhile, bring the broth to a simmer. Peel and thinly slice the daikon and add to the broth. Trim and thinly slice the celery and add to broth. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
0739210c-b8be-4e57-b736-ad930c5febb7 Cut tofu into small cubes or thin slices.
0739210c-b8be-4e57-b736-ad930c5febb7 Add the tofu and the reserved mushrooms to the broth. Add reserved soaking liquid, being careful to leave any grit behind. Cook, simmering until everything is heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.
0739210c-b8be-4e57-b736-ad930c5febb7 Divide between 4 bowls and garnish with cilantro, if you like. Serve immediately.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Gather the ingredients.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Coat a large frying pan or wok with oil and sauté pork over medium-high heat until almost cooked through. Drain oil if necessary.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Add garlic and sauté for a couple of more minutes, mixing to combine.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Add kimchi and fry for about 5 to 7 minutes, until it becomes a darker reddish brown.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Add sugar, soy sauce, sesame seeds, and sesame oil and fry for another minute.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Remove from heat.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b In a pot of gently boiling water, boil entire block of tofu for 3 minutes.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Drain tofu and slice into rectangles.
32fe2635-c269-4768-8ed9-d6ad5cb1de9b Serve topped with sautéed kimchi (kimchi bokum) or place kimchi in the center of the plate and arrange tofu around it.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Gather the ingredients.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Sauté the beef in 1/2 tablespoon of the sesame oil in a soup pot for a few minutes.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Add kimchi to the pot and stir-fry for about 5 minutes.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Add remaining oil, onion, garlic, gochujang, gochugaru, and soy sauce, mixing to combine. Pour the water into the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Cook for 20 to 30 minutes to concentrate the flavors, adding the tofu after the first 10 minutes.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Add the scallions at the very end.
c2f3165d-7dae-4f86-9860-d94538f37648 Serve this stew immediately after cooking, accompanied by steamed white rice.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 Gather the ingredients.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 First, prepare your tofu. Like most vegan tofu recipes, this one will taste best if you press the tofu first.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 Slice the tofu into desired "finger" shapes, about 1/2-inch wide and 1/2-inch thick. Arrange tofu pieces in a wide, shallow container
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, and liquid sweetener. Pour this mixture over the tofu slices, and allow to marinate for at least one hour, and up to overnight. The longer the better! Turn the tofu occasionally to ensure all sides are well coated.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 In a shallow dish, place the breadcrumbs. Remove tofu from marinade and bread the marinated tofu slices.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 Fry the breaded tofu slices in oil over medium heat until golden brown on all sides. Gently remove from oil and allow excess oil to drain on paper towels.
f2f56d80-f1d1-40b3-9288-cad3e7479892 Serve your fried tofu fingers with a dipping sauce, such as ketchup, barbecue sauce, hot mustard or an Asian plum sauce. Enjoy!
1bb6cb0e-5466-4648-9855-b6cac8c7db8c Gather the ingredients.
1bb6cb0e-5466-4648-9855-b6cac8c7db8c In a medium bowl, mix tofu and oil together until smooth. Set aside.
1bb6cb0e-5466-4648-9855-b6cac8c7db8c Combine remaining ingredients (except vegetable broth) in a mixing bowl. On low speed, blend in the tofu mixture for 1 minute. Scrape sides and mix another 3 minutes at medium speed. Let it sit for 5 minutes.
1bb6cb0e-5466-4648-9855-b6cac8c7db8c In a saucepan over medium or medium-low heat, place matzah ball mixture in broth by the tablespoonfuls. Let the broth boil for 35 minutes, covered.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Loosen the precooked noodles by soaking in a bowl of hot water for 2 to 3 minutes, then drain and set aside.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and water in a bowl.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat, add the oil and stir-fry the carrot and broccoli for 2 minutes.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Add the tofu and stir-fry for 4 minutes.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for a minute.
c1255764-a87f-41ea-b297-8c741d952945 Stir in the noodles and then add the sauce mixture and cashews and mix until thoroughly combined and heated through.
0c656e79-62b9-4de7-a7c2-3d7f37722791 Combine the tofu, vanilla, and sugar in a blender or a food processor and process until smooth.
0c656e79-62b9-4de7-a7c2-3d7f37722791 With the machine running, gradually add the soy milk through the feeder cap.
0c656e79-62b9-4de7-a7c2-3d7f37722791 Refrigerate until serving time. It will keep for a week, but it can also be frozen.
3dabb872-ac66-4e9e-88ad-15883e1c14dc Gather the ingredients.
3dabb872-ac66-4e9e-88ad-15883e1c14dc Combine all ingredients using a blender or food processor. If mixing by hand, use a fork or whisk and beat until smooth.Instead of using a small bowl and a whisk, you can also place everything together in a mason jar, cover, and then shake it all up until fully emulsified.
3dabb872-ac66-4e9e-88ad-15883e1c14dc Add a bit of water, a teaspoon at a time, if desired, for a thinner consistency.
3dabb872-ac66-4e9e-88ad-15883e1c14dc Serve as the dressing to a salad or use as a dipping sauce and enjoy!
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad Make the miso sauce (marinade). In a small bowl, combine miso, sugar, honey, minced garlic and ginger juice (or finely minced ginger), and sesame oil. Mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste (optional). If you'd like to add green onion (or "nira" garlic chives), chop finely, then add to the marinade and mix well. If you like, reserve some of the chopped green onion for garnish. Set the miso sauce aside.
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad If you are using thicker pork loin cuts instead of the medium thin (or sukiyaki cut) sliced pork, be sure to cut the thicker loins in half with a horizontal cut to make them slightly thinner.
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad Generously brush each slice of pork with the miso sauce, and then stack the slices one on top of the other in a deep dish or bowl to marinate.
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad Marinate the pork for 20 to 30 minutes. If you don't have time to marinate the pork, the pork may be cooked with the sauce and still have good flavor.
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad In a non-stick pan, heat pork until done. Or, coat pan with olive oil if needed and then saute and until pork is cooked through and the sauce has browned slightly.
ae67df82-d51d-4919-92d1-babe6c0a95ad Serve the miso pork with a side of green leafy lettuce or Japanese shungiku and wrap the pork with the greens and then enjoy!
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Put dashi soup stock in a pan and bring to a boil.
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Cut tofu into small cubes and add them to the soup.
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Simmer the tofu for a few minutes on low heat.
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Scoop out some soup stock from the pan and dissolve miso in it.
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Gradually return the miso mixture in the soup. Stir the soup gently. Stop the heat and add chopped green onion.
d8ded17d-7f6f-4cc0-9857-9a68183c04ea Try not to boil the soup after you put miso in.
edb8e91d-c0b5-461a-a6a5-233e4b7586f5 Soak the raisins in the water for up to an hour or until they are very mushy.
edb8e91d-c0b5-461a-a6a5-233e4b7586f5 Blend the raisins and the raisin soak water together with the remaining ingredients until smooth and saucy.
edb8e91d-c0b5-461a-a6a5-233e4b7586f5 Serve immediately or store in an airtight glass container in the refrigerator for up to a week.
c81b8ce7-3c56-412b-b968-d7bfdc3f077e Gather the ingredients.
c81b8ce7-3c56-412b-b968-d7bfdc3f077e In a large saucepan or stock pot, bring the dashi or stock to a simmer over medium-high heat but do not boil. Combine the white and red miso in a small dish, then add 1 1/2 cups of the hot dashi and whisk to combine. Set aside.
c81b8ce7-3c56-412b-b968-d7bfdc3f077e Simmer the dashi for 5 minutes more. Gently stir in the tofu and simmer for another 5 minutes. Again - do not boil! Add the baby bok choy, scallions, and miso mixture, and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the bok choy is slightly wilted but still bright green.
c81b8ce7-3c56-412b-b968-d7bfdc3f077e Serve immediately while hot, taking care to stir before serving as the miso will settle.
c81b8ce7-3c56-412b-b968-d7bfdc3f077e Enjoy!
8afb0d75-5b76-4e41-b2de-f880a9d4ca38 In a large pot, saute the tomatoes, leek, and mushroom for 1 to 3 minutes.
8afb0d75-5b76-4e41-b2de-f880a9d4ca38 Add the vegetable broth and seaweed and bring to a slow simmer. Add the tofu, soy sauce (or the gluten-free tamari or Nama Shoyu if you're doing the gluten-free version), and the miso and scallions and reduce the heat to low.
8afb0d75-5b76-4e41-b2de-f880a9d4ca38 Stir well to dissolve and mix the miso.
8afb0d75-5b76-4e41-b2de-f880a9d4ca38 Allow to cook for at least 8 more minutes over low heat.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Gather the ingredients.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Preheat the oven to 350 Fand grease a 9 x 9-inch pan with cooking spray or softened butter. Line the bottom with a piece of parchment paper.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Place the butter and sugars in a large mixing bowl and whisk until fully incorporated.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Add the eggs and yolk one at a time, whisking gently after each addition. Add the vanilla and gently whisk again.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Add the miso and whisk until smooth.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Whisk the flour, baking powder and salt together in a medium sized bowl. Add the chunks to the bowl and whisk again.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Add the dry ingredients to the wet and using a rubber spatula, very gently fold the two together. Do not over-mix.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Transfer the batter to the prepared pan and use a flexible spatula to smooth the top.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Sprinkle the Maldon sea salt (if using) over the top of the blondies.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Bake for about 35 to 38 minutes, until the top is browned and a toothpick comes out with a moist crumb or two.
c42f02e4-8b96-4efd-95f0-96a1ac9f9cde Let the blondies cool on a rack until room temp and slice and serve.
f09a8db2-594f-4784-9e2f-7ea78f6e137b Preheat grill for medium-low heat.
f09a8db2-594f-4784-9e2f-7ea78f6e137b Combine marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
f09a8db2-594f-4784-9e2f-7ea78f6e137b Place mixture on the flesh of salmon fillet and let sit for 5 or so minutes.
f09a8db2-594f-4784-9e2f-7ea78f6e137b Place salmon on a well-oiled grill grate, skin-side down, and cook for about 12 to 14 minutes (or until internal temperature at thickest part of fillet reads 145 F).
f09a8db2-594f-4784-9e2f-7ea78f6e137b Once cooked through, remove from heat and serve.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Gather the ingredients.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Heat canola oil in a large deep skillet or a wok over medium-high heat. Add minced ginger, garlic, and ground pork to the skillet and saute on medium heat until the pork is done.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c To the skillet with the meat, add carrot, bean sprouts, and cabbage and saute together for a few minutes until vegetables are tender.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Pour warm water into the skillet. Season with chicken bouillon powder or chicken base, sugar, and soy sauce and bring the soup to a boil. Turn down the heat to low, and melt miso in the soup. Add sesame oil last, and then turn off the heat.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c In the meantime, prepare the noodles. Boil water in a large pot. Put chukamen noodles into the boiling water and cook for a few minutes, until the noodles are al dente, or reach your desired firmness. Drain the noodles well and serve in two deep soup noodle bowls.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Pour the hot miso soup mixture with pork and vegetables over the noodles.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Add optional garnishes.
a31b6992-7de9-4831-8012-49726502b22c Serve and enjoy!
95965bdd-133f-4fe1-a626-b3ac35eaffc2 First, in a skillet or saucepan, sautee the minced garlic, the minced onions and the sliced mushrooms in vegan margarine until soft, and then set aside.
95965bdd-133f-4fe1-a626-b3ac35eaffc2 In separate medium-sized saucepan, combine the miso, soy milk and vegetarian bouillon cube over medium to low heat. Stir these ingredients together until the bouillon cube has fully dissolved and ingredients are well combined.
95965bdd-133f-4fe1-a626-b3ac35eaffc2 Next, add in the onion powder, flour, celery salt, soy sauce, and the nutritional yeast, and bring to a slow slimmer, stirring to combine well. If your mixture does not thicken, add more flour, mix well and turn up the heat a bit. Allow to cool.
95965bdd-133f-4fe1-a626-b3ac35eaffc2 Next, add the sauteed mushrooms, garlic, and onion mix to the soy milk mix and process in a blender or food processor until smooth or until the desired texture is reached.
95965bdd-133f-4fe1-a626-b3ac35eaffc2 Reheat the blended mix, stirring occasionally, and allow to cool slightly before transferring to a fondue pot for serving.
d335cc78-da9a-43eb-bdde-3ba3781596de Make a thick (less watery) batch of cashew milk for this recipe, closer to a raw cashew cream than raw cashew milk.
d335cc78-da9a-43eb-bdde-3ba3781596de Process together the cashew cream or thick cashew milk in a food processor or blender along with the fresh lemon juice, miso, garlic, chopped onion, olive oil, and nutritional yeast until thick and creamy. This should take about one full minute on medium or high speed (be patient!).
d335cc78-da9a-43eb-bdde-3ba3781596de That's it! Taste and adjust the flavors to your personal liking. You can add a bit of salt and fresh ground pepper if you'd like, or if it's not salty enough for you, add a bit more miso or even a tiny bit of tamari or Nama Shoyu.
d335cc78-da9a-43eb-bdde-3ba3781596de Serve and enjoy over salad, steamed veggies, zoodles, or your raw food meal of choice.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 Sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until soft, about 4 to 5 minutes.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 Add spinach and salt, stirring to combine well and cook just until spinach is heated through.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 Add crumbled tofu and mix well. Allow to cool completely.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the cashew or almond butter, soy milk, miso, soy sauce, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, and onion powder until smooth and creamy.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 Prepare the lasagna noodles according to package instructions, if needed, and preheat oven to 350 F.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 In a lightly greased lasagna pan, place a thin layer of the white cashew sauce and then a layer of noodles. Next, add spinach and more cashew white sauce, then a layer of noodles, continuing until all ingredients are used up. The top layer should be spinach and then sauce.
ea896928-abb3-4c71-93c0-676b77ed57d9 Bake for 40 minutes, or until done. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before serving, to allow lasagna to set.
a548b3f1-20e2-4576-be7b-bab88f79c075 Gather the ingredients.
a548b3f1-20e2-4576-be7b-bab88f79c075 Heat water just to a low simmer, then reduce the heat so the water is hot but not actually simmering or boiling and then stir in the miso. You want to be careful that the water doesn't boil when you add in the miso, but rather it should be just below the boiling point.
a548b3f1-20e2-4576-be7b-bab88f79c075 Stir well to fully dissolve the miso and make sure there are no clumps, then, stir in the remaining ingredients and allow to heat for a couple minutes, just to gently soften the garlic and mushrooms.
a548b3f1-20e2-4576-be7b-bab88f79c075 Stir well, and serve.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Gather the ingredients.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Combine the miso and the water and whisk them both together until the miso is completely dissolved in the water. You can also heat the water up a bit first in order to speed up this process.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 In a large skillet, melt the vegan margarine over medium-low heat and whisk in the flour until a paste forms.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Add the miso and water mixture, vegetable broth, soy sauce, nutritional yeast, and black pepper. Stir to combine very well.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Allow to cook over low heat until thickened, stirring frequently. Just like when making a non-vegan gravy, you will need to do a lot of stirring to avoid any lumps forming as the liquid thickens up.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Add the cornstarch, if needed, to make the gravy even thicker. But don't forget that your gravy will thicken slightly as it cools, just like a meat-based gravy.
732fec34-421a-48b3-81a4-112e42f75255 Serve and enjoy!
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Slice eggplant in half lengthwise, then into 1/4 inch-thick cubes and half-rounds.
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Optional: Place cut eggplant pieces into a large colander and sprinkle with salt. Leave standing for 30 minutes for the bitter juices to drain away.
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Mix miso, mirin, and sugar in a small bowl and set aside. (If the miso glaze has been prepared and frozen ahead of time, warm-up the miso glaze in the microwave for just 30 seconds so that its nice and warm.)
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Heat oil in a medium skillet and fry eggplants on medium heat until softened.
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Add green bell pepper and stir-fry them until softened.
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Turn heat to low.
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Add miso mixture and stir quickly with the ingredients. (If the sauce begins to burn, lower the heat some more and add 1-2 tbsp. of water to the pan)
37164d65-e646-4506-b1d6-d2ed72747d7b Remove from heat, stir in toppings and serve hot.
00c911c4-4565-49a0-a379-9d1464897b01 Pre-heat oven to broil or highest setting. Cover a cookie sheet with tin foil. Combine all ingredients except tofu and oil using blender or mixer. Slowly add oil and mix until smooth and creamy. Pour mixture into wide bowl or pan.
00c911c4-4565-49a0-a379-9d1464897b01 Cut tofu into 1/2 inch thick pieces and dip into miso mixture until coated with a thin layer, reserving some of the mixture.
00c911c4-4565-49a0-a379-9d1464897b01 Gently lay tofu pieces on covered cookie sheet. Broil 8 to 10 minutes until golden brown and slightly crisp. Remove from oven.
00c911c4-4565-49a0-a379-9d1464897b01 Turn the pieces over and "baste" another layer of miso mixture over the pieces with a spoon. Broil 8 to 10 more minutes until browned and crisp. Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired and enjoy!

d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 For the Meatballs:

d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1/2 cup sweet onion (minced)

d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 For the Garlic Bread:
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1 loaf of artisan Italian bread (from the bakery, sliced 1/2-inch thick)
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1/2 cup mayonnaise (or as needed)
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1 teaspoon garlic powder
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
d36cfe92-cdd8-4c6a-99e5-fc601155b2d6 1/2 teaspoon salt
